Recycled Plastics.title: A Dim Vision Of Something Lovely That Is Forever Just Out Of Reach
Recycled Plastics.label: Milieu Music Digital
Recycled Plastics.about: Having not released any new music for almost ten years, Blaubac has returned from the wilderness with visions of the void and exposure to mutagenic radiation. What has emerged is almost unrecognizable, a strange construct of man and machine, bound together via alien systems of symbiosis. Here, he issues eleven arrangements of modular synthesis and windswept isolationism - tracks that run like mechanical tattoos across atom blasted landscapes, beneath a cracked-glass sun that spills purples, oranges and greens out over the bubbling atmosphere. Somewhere, inside all of the winding pathways of metallic installations, seeps a melancholic haze - a blank sadness that echoes the loss of self among the deserted cities and black salt deserts. These visions never resolve themselves, the sonic messages never reach their terminus...instead, they clamber on, lurching endlessly forward through the wreckage of the past, assimilating pieces they find useful along the way, and abandoning all else. Hopeless probes forever wandering/wondering, blinking cursors on dim greenscreens, failed programs, derelict seeds without purpose.
Recycled Plastics.credits:
released July 6, 2018
W/P by Chris Smith. Created with modular synthesizer, direct to stereo in a single take, with no editing in post. Thoughtfully mastered by The Analog Botanist at the White Pillar Workshop. Design and text by ABM&D. This is Recycled Plastics number BC68, and 68th in the Bedroom Compost catalog.

Recycled Plastics.label: Milieu Music Digital
Recycled Plastics.about: Fresh out of a victorious battle for the Egret's Crystal, NN* returns with completely replenished HP and MP and a lovely addition to the ACID SUMMER. His trademark ice cream truck melodies take precedence over the electro-fantasy drum grooves, and A Heart Is A Forest is catchy enough to get even the bridge troll to start breakdancing. While this is an EP, there is a special limited edition CD-R component that contains FOUR additional tracks, effectively making it a brand new full-length album! A perfect compliment to your rainbow icepops!
Recycled Plastics.credits:

Recycled Plastics.title: A Place For Us
Recycled Plastics.label: Milieu Music Digital
Recycled Plastics.about:
Sliding comfortably into BC45 is a sugar-sweet EP from Gene Mantua, warmly titled A Place For Us. Gene's released only one other EP before this - Moon-Glo All Skate at Sequel Sound - but that shouldn't sway you. The sounds here are familiar and feel-good electronics, the very foundation upon which RP was conceived. Somehow, on only 7 tracks, Gene manages to make us recall Autechre's Amber and Squarepusher's Weird Things, while also channeling the emotive strains from things like Fieldtriqp, Am-Boy, early Ten and Tracer and so on. We don't know how he does it, but A Place For Us really feels like home. Thanks, Gene.
For maximum effect, check out the limited edition CD-R, which contains a rare remix of "Days On Nights" from Milieu!
Recycled Plastics.credits:
released September 1, 2015
W/P by Gene Mantua. Mastered by The Analog Botanist. This is Recycled Plastics number BC45, and 45th in the Bedroom Compost catalog.

Recycled Plastics.title: Abmho Penthousing
Recycled Plastics.label: Milieu Music Digital
Recycled Plastics.about: The sophomore release as Troth at Recycled Plastics is Abmho Penthousing. As previously mentioned when Combs Hydros came out, Troth is a project centered around using acoustic instruments and acoustic room environments in tandem with analog tape and various types of electronic devices. TR1 was the most conventional sounding example, so it was released first. Now, TR2 begins to feel out more of the exploratory sounds Troth was meant for. The thumb pianos, plucked strings, bells and metal bowls are all still present, but the tracks themselves are far more organic and fractured things. Acoustic room reverbs and all manner of textural noise mingle around with drum machines gone spastic/plastic, while delays, flangers and modulators crumple up the melodies like trashed pieces of notebook paper. Abmho Penthousing is a playful EP that sits perfectly within the Recycled Plastics ethos.
Recycled Plastics.credits:
released November 25, 2012
W/P by Brian Grainger. Recorded at Botany Bay, 2011-2012. This is Recycled Plastics number TR2.

Recycled Plastics.title: Academy Stripes
Recycled Plastics.label: Milieu Music Digital
Recycled Plastics.about: As Milieu reaches its 9th year as a project, what better way to celebrate but with a brand new record? Academy Stripes is Milieu's 36th full-length album of original material, and the first at Recycled Plastics. So what should you expect to hear? A colorful assortment of happy-sad melodies in about a dozen different flavors, cast like a sunbeam over energetic drum machine programming and funky bass that floats elegantly like sex in space. The trademark attributes of the Milieu sound are still there - lots of creative detuning, analog signal processing and a focus on psychedelics that should bring a smile to just about anyone. Carefree feel-good music is complemented by elements of dualities (or maybe even stripes) that are noticeable in both the music and the track titles. Right on time for the Summer, released on Brian's 30th birthday, and ready to lovingly caress large and small speakers everywhere.
Recycled Plastics.credits:
released May 17, 2013
W/P by Brian Grainger. Recorded at Botany Bay, 2011-2013. Mastered by The Analog Botanist. Album design by Eric Adrian Lee. A knowing wink, secret handshake and friendly high-five to Richard on track #8. Thanks to Herc, Hastings, Japp and Lemon. This is Recycled Plastics number RP5.

Recycled Plastics.title: Acid Affairs
Recycled Plastics.label: Milieu Music Digital
Recycled Plastics.about: As a lovely limited edition bookend for the 2013 year at RP, Mr. Acid has assembled a massive 80-track double-album: Acid Affairs. Compiling his archives from the Squawk! directive, as well as all known recordings captured by Acid Jock during his Techno Box surveillance, and including several exclusive bonus cuts only available on this album - Acid Affairs is a vital chapter in the Bedroom Compost series at RP and the ultimate emblem of what the Acid Summer really was like. Each purchase of the 2xCD-R set comes with a free Acid Summer sticker!
Recycled Plastics.credits:
released December 16, 2013
Written and produced by Mr. Acid, with additional production values by Acid Jock. Mixed by DJ Brain Salad. Mastered by The Analog Botanist. Stickers by Phil A. Cid. This is Recycled Plastics number BCPH, and #PH in the ongoing Bedroom Compost imprint.

Recycled Plastics.title: Acid Scents
Recycled Plastics.label: Milieu Music Digital
Recycled Plastics.about:
DR Phlux is the newest standard issue rhythm machine at Recycled Plastics, known by other designators as Kor and Phoen. Hailing from Warsaw, DR Phlux specializes in rubbery low end filled with fatty acids and beats that won't repeat on you after dinner. ACID SCENTS is the first of several new releases from this Polish wunderkind, blasting your summer off the map with a white hot acid laser. Throughout this release you will surf the soundwaves happily through warm fronts of tape hiss and vanishing point delays, with just as much sentimentality weaving through the melodies as there is swank. And as you know, it don't mean a think if it ain't got that swank.
Pick up the CD-R version for 4 bonus Phlux trax plus a bouncy remix by MILIEU to prop that sleepy last quarter up, and also be sure to check out the recently reissued/expanded TRANSACIDS CD-R by Kor!
Recycled Plastics.credits:
released September 11, 2016
W/P by DR Phlux. Mastered by The Analog Botanist. This is Recycled Plastics number BC 51 and 51st in the ongoing Bedroom Compost series.

Recycled Plastics.title: Acid Styles
Recycled Plastics.label: Milieu Music Digital
Recycled Plastics.about: The reclusive Mr. Acid returns from an extended undercover top-secret acid mission, where he is rumored to have spent a year moonlighting as a bell clerk at a luxurious hotel in Moscow...or was it Moldova? We'll never know. All we're given is a discreet unmarked folder filled with aerial surveillance photos, xeroxed receipts for pizza and a suspicious looking disc containing thirteen more audio files, which are presented here. On Acid Styles, Mr. Acid widens his range a bit, and we see him playfully making tracks that are only slightly longer than the ADD channel-changers on Squawk! and Techno Box. As such, things get a little more funky, a little more rubbery, maybe even a little glossy (!) but never straying very far from his comfortable pH level. We were going to save this one for the next Acid Summer marathon, but fuck it - this record needs to be heard! Felt! Fondled! Seen to be believed! Don't take our word for it, take some acid.
Recycled Plastics.credits:
released March 21, 2016
W/P by Mr. Acid. Mastered by The Analog Botanist. This is Recycled Plastics number BC48, and 48th in the Bedroom Compost catalog.

Recycled Plastics.title: Alchemical Union
Recycled Plastics.label: Milieu Music Digital
Recycled Plastics.about: Brother Blue, the deep dub techno side of Tim Gray (aka Ethernet, Tanuki House) returns to Recycled Plastics with a lush hour-long live recording of his set in Portland on June 24, 2016, at Moonchild's Odyssey space. This lovely recording came to us mastered by the man himself, with the intent to have it issued freely on the Summer Solstice. Crafted masterfully with Gray's live hardware rig, which consisted of his Elektron Analog Rytm, MFB-522 and DSI Tetra in conjunction with several FX units and a cassette Walkman prepped with what Gray describes as "cosmic hiss." Enjoy this grooving walk through a PDX dub haze, on the advent of Summer - this one's on us.
Recycled Plastics.credits:
released June 20, 2017
Written, produced & performed by Tim Gray. Recorded live on the occasion of Morgan & Andria's wedding, at Moonchild's Odyssey space, Portland, OR / June 24, 2016. Performed with Elektron Analog Rytm, MFB-522, DSI Tetra & FX pedals + cosmic hiss tape via Walkman. Mastered by Tim Gray. This is Recycled Plastics number BC56, 56th in the ongoing Bedroom Compost catalog.

Recycled Plastics.title: An Expensive Vase
Recycled Plastics.label: Milieu Music Digital
Recycled Plastics.about:
An Expensive Vase is the first of several scheduled albums by Media Them at Recycled Plastics. The sound of Media Them is a unique blend of warm atmospherics and organic rhythms - electronic music reduced to the simplest of loops, repeating infinitely. It is both minimalist and maximalist at once, as Media Them's composition lies not in the makeup of these loops, but rather, the size of the window we're glimpsing them through. Small breaths of melody, heart flutters of bass, snare and hi hat and the coziest bedroom production give way to expanding universes of color and sonic exploration without end. Did that sound just repeat one more time than it did before? Was that other sound even playing since the start of the track? Media Them beckons you to refocus your ears and get lost in a beautiful hypnosis of music and mind.
We've been so obsessed with Media Them music since discovering it, that there is now an exclusive catalog subset reserved only for Media Them records. These albums will be free to download, but super-limited edition CD-R runs of 25 copies each will be available as well. We'd like you to reserve a special space on your record shelf for the Media Them collection - we know that we certainly will.
Recycled Plastics.credits:
released June 20, 2013
W/P by Media Them. Mastered by The Analog Botanist at Botany Bay, Summer 2013. This is Recycled Plastics number MT1. Digital cover designed by Eric Adrian Lee.

Recycled Plastics.title: Antauen
Recycled Plastics.label: Milieu Music Digital
Recycled Plastics.about: Sometimes, music makes itself, or at least it seems to. Antauen began with inspiration striking Argentinian producer Matias Bagato (aka Orson Throb, and one of the minds behind Temiong Recordings) to remix the Coppice Halifax track "Antu" from Radians (RP4). This mix was simply too good to let it fall by the wayside, so within a week of hearing it, we drafted the help of French producer Zwei Kreise (previously known as Axs) to fill out what would be a spontaneous single. Coppice Halifax went back to the source sounds for "Antu" as well, bringing into existence ANTAUEN, a heavy new track that slices through the original audio with a white-hot laser, ready to storm the decks. Once the leading single and the supporting mixes were laid out, tangents began to manifest, and both Zwei Kreise and Coppice Halifax went even deeper into "Antu" to excavate three more mixes: ZK's being a low-res nod to vintage game soundtracking, and CH's being a 40-minute drone-techno monolith with a washed out reprise. These experimental extras are only available as bonus tracks on the CD-R version of Antauen, which fully adds up to 71 minutes of new sound for your ears to process. Grab BC46 and thaw yourself out in deep space today.
Recycled Plastics.credits:
released October 19, 2015
#1 W/P by Coppice Halifax. Recorded at Botany Bay, Autumn 2015. #2-4 written by Coppice Halifax, produced & remixed by the credited artists. Recorded in Argentina and France, Summer 2015. Mastered by The Analog Botanist. This is Recycled Plastics number BC46, and 46th in the Bedroom Compost series.

Recycled Plastics.title: AQV
Recycled Plastics.label: Milieu Music Digital
Recycled Plastics.about: AQV, named for the Alesis Quadraverb FX unit it was principally recorded with, begins the Bedroom Compost series with a three-track EP. At times soft like velour and at times as jagged as a rusty bucket, the AQV EP travels melodic 90's braindance terrain rather effortlessly, recalling the nostalgic olden days of full-size monitors, dialup modems and non-wireless video game console controllers. Heavily inspired by the early Rephlex and Warp catalogs, AQV's music should fit comfortably alongside those blurry memories of the electronic renaissance.
Recycled Plastics.credits:
released October 16, 2011
W/P by AQV. Recorded at Foxhill. This is Recycled Plastics number BC1, and first in the Bedroom Compost series.

Recycled Plastics.title: Auslser Kunststoffe
Recycled Plastics.label: Milieu Music Digital
Recycled Plastics.about:
In the end of 2018, I was commissioned by Sebastian Gansrigler, the creative mind behind the ZEN mobile game and 'Die Letzt Kupferdrucker' (a short documentary film about Europe's last copper printer in Vienna), to provide musical score, sound effects and transitional sound material for a series of advertising campaign videos that would introduce his boutique photography magazine Auslser. Having previously provided scoring work for both ZEN (whose soundtrack resides here at RP) and 'Kupferdrucker', I was elated to work with Sebastian once again on another new and entirely different project.
Auslser is a beautifully minimalist photography magazine that is printed in Austria biannually. It can be purchased in over 50 carefully selected galleries, museum shops, magazine- and bookstores worldwide from Vienna to Russia, from Portugal to China, and as a single edition and subscription direct from Auslser's website. Furthermore, you can find every issue at many universities and in libraries from Zurich to Amsterdam.
Musically, the sounds presented here are almost entirely sketches and palette-tests that would serve as liminal progress markers toward what ended up being refined and utilized in Auslser marketing actions. Many of the recordings are completely informal and are presented here less as 'music' in a composed sense, and more as an interesting insight into my scoring process, patchmaking and perhaps even as a document of one of the more unique commissions that have come my way. Everything was created using a Korg Minilogue polyphonic analog synthesizer, except the 'Tanzmix' which was built alongside samplers, drum machines and overdubs using the Minilogue in different patch configurations, to provide a "single" for this otherwise noncommercial album...although it is somewhat ironic that music drafted for actual commercial use ends up presented more as library music than anything you'd typically find in modern advertising otherwise.
Auslser Kunststoffe, or "Shutter Button Plastics", would likely appeal to fans of my Eufloria or ZEN soundtrack recordings, as well as Milieu albums like Improvisations For Hylian Piano & Woodwinds (also recorded using the same polysynth), Daughter or Quebrith & Yarrow.
Recycled Plastics.credits:
released September 4, 2020
W/P by Brian Grainger. Commissioned by Sebastian Gansrigler for Auslser  ausloeser.org  Recorded at White Pillar Workshop, Autumn-Winter 2018. Mastered by The Analog Botanist. Text by ABM&D. Cover design by Sebastian Gansrigler for Auslser. This is Recycled Plastics number RP13.  milieu-music.com  /  analogbotany.com

Recycled Plastics.title: Automatic Writing
Recycled Plastics.label: Milieu Music Digital
Recycled Plastics.about: Heralding the beginning of the leafy and smoky season with the Autumn Equinox, Brother Blue returns with a new dub techno single, Automatic Writing. Featuring two different takes of the track, it foreshadows a new EP that will soon follow. Enjoy the bounty of the year's crops, the annual decay of their remains and the cool incense evenings to come.
Recycled Plastics.credits:
released September 23, 2018
W/P by Tim Gray. Recorded during Winter 2016 in Portland, OR using Elektron Analog Rytm, Roland Alpha Juno-2, Waldorf Microwave II + FX pedals, sequenced and recorded in Ableton Live. Text and design by ABM&D. This is Recycled Plastics number BC72, and 72nd in the ongoing Bedroom Compost subcatalog.

Recycled Plastics.title: Avalon (Remixes)
Recycled Plastics.label: Milieu Music Digital
Recycled Plastics.about: Following his psychedelic opus ON DOING/BEING ORDINARY, Foamek returns with a "single" for the album cut AVALON, which runs no less than 78 minutes, packed like a car full of stoned teenagers with tape hiss blanketed techno tangents. Foamek himself turns in two alternate mixes of Avalon, backed by three non-album tracks (one of which was previously issued on a charity compilation) that further expand his unique voice with bittersweet melodies, nostalgic sound palette and an undeniable dance beat. Closing out the set is a 17 minute Coppice Halifax remix that warps, detunes and recontextualizes Avalon into a pastoral Summer feelgood, and for a special treat, listeners who pick up the limited edition CD-R will also get a second CH remix (clocking in at 34 minutes!) that recalls influences like Yagya, Pub and the Chain Reaction catalogue. Look no further - Foamek has the sound of your Summer days and nights both covered!
Recycled Plastics.credits:
released August 13, 2018
W/P by Jake Davis, except #7/8: Written by Jake Davis, Produced & remixed by Coppice Halifax. Mastered by The Analog Botanist. Text and design by ABM&D. This is Recycled Plastics number BC71, and 71st in the ongoing Bedroom Compost catalogue.

Recycled Plastics.title: Beatless
Recycled Plastics.label: Milieu Music Digital
Recycled Plastics.about:
Substak's Beatless comes at a perfect time seasonally, with the current weather here consisting of cold days, showers and leafless trees. Beatless is an exercise in depth and dimension, showcasing Substak's talents for crafting alien sonics and ominous atmospherics. While Beatless is devoid of a kick drum, it is not entirely arrhythmic. There are occasional bits of hi hat, or the noticeable angles of a looped sequence, or even an oscillating pattern that pulses in time. In this way, it almost sounds as if Substak is at odds with his music, and rather than creating it wholesale, he is actually conjuring up elemental forces and doing his best to rein them in. What we're left with is all cold - cold sheets of droning fog that hint at icy dub-inspired chord structures buried beneath them, cold track titles that separate any artistic intent from the sound you hear and replace it with a simple number. Cold silence before, between and after tracks, itself a black nameless void that Substak lures his sounds out of before marking them as his own and exiling them back to wherever they came from. This, along with the Monophon album by Mon0, is the deepest Recycled Plastics has dared to dive in the Bedroom Compost series so far. There's enough exploration here for you to stay in bed for a week.
The limited edition CD-R includes a special 17 minute Coppice Halifax remix as a bonus track.
Recycled Plastics.credits:
released January 12, 2015
W/P by Kostas Staikos. Mastered by The Analog Botanist. This is Recycled Plastics number BC35, and 35th in the ongoing Bedroom Compost catalog set.

Recycled Plastics.title: Beckons
Recycled Plastics.label: Milieu Music Digital
Recycled Plastics.about: It's finally Summertime, but press play, close your eyes and you'd never be able to tell. Lamont Kohner's third single for RP lands with a roomy bass pulse and a dusty loop that slowly splits open to reveal white noise-crusted dub chords and a thumping traincar rhythm. BECKONS does what it says on the tin, with minimal side effects, drawing us into the seedy nightlife of Kohner's noir cityscapes and neon vapors. Following the irresistible groove of BECKONS is CLOSE IT, a slightly more traditional dub techno affair, recalling the Detroit strains of Deepchord and Echospace while also conjuring a thick-as-a-brick rhythmic foundation that goes even further back to the first couple Maurizio 12"s in Germany. The whole thing congeals into that trademark Kohner shuffle, and we're once again sitting back in a darkened taxi, window half open, smoke wafting out into the greasy streets. Falling beneath the music's spell, you feel compelled to close the window - we're doing something intimate in here.
Recycled Plastics.credits:
released June 30, 2019
W/P by Lamont Kohner. Text and design by ABM&D. This is Recycled Plastics number K3, and third in the K subcatalog of Lamont Kohner recordings.

Recycled Plastics.title: Bismuth Cosmolog
Recycled Plastics.label: Milieu Music Digital
Recycled Plastics.about:
Milieu returns to Recycled Plastics, bearing a new catalog of improvisations and excerpts from live performances. Bismuth Cosmolog will consist of tracks (or sections) taken from live Milieu sets, which Brian felt were better off in these isolated pieces than as a part of a longer session. Since the process of Milieu sets is ongoing, so too will the series be.
This first volume opens with the namesake track, a 14-minute exploration on only two pieces of hardware (a Korg Minilogue polyphonic analog synthesizer and a Teenage Electronics PO-12 drum machine). Phasing from melodic braindance bounce to something more plaintive and calm, it leaves the door wide open for Friday Night Lazer, a rehearsal of the live set that has since been released as Saturday Night Lazer at Milieu Music. In some ways, Friday is the "single version" of Saturday, although it's a little more spaced out in the lead lines than its companion. Friday was created using four Korg Volca machines (Bass/Beats/Keys/Sample). The two Age Onyx tracks originated from a quite heavy test session for the Minilogue and PO-12, with the latter playing ping-pong with an Alesis Quadraverb's sampler mode and a Synthrotek PT2399, to really fuck everything up. Bismuth Beats is a single piece, split into two distinct sections, that further mutates the same sequences and patches used on the title track.
Bismuth Cosmolog will be a simple but funky series of live curiosities and snapshots of moments where the vibrations in the air seemed to be mingling just right. Originating from live recordings means these tracks are best enjoyed very loud on a stereo system with substantial low end output!
Recycled Plastics.credits:
released September 14, 2018
W/P by Brian Grainger. Improvised and recorded live at White Pillar Workshop. Mastered by The Analog Botanist. Design and text by ABM&D. This is Recycled Plastics number COSM01.

Recycled Plastics.title: Bismuth Cosmolog 2
Recycled Plastics.label: Milieu Music Digital
Recycled Plastics.about:
Milieu returns to Recycled Plastics, bearing a new catalog of improvisations and excerpts from live performances. Bismuth Cosmolog will consist of tracks (or sections) taken from live Milieu sets, which Brian felt were better off in these isolated pieces than as a part of a longer session. Since the process of Milieu sets is ongoing, so too will the series be.
This second volume opens with Phronesis, a funky and offbeat jam recorded on Brian's wife's birthday with a Boss DR-110 drum machine controlling four Korg Volca machines (Bass/Beats/Keys/Sample), a Teenage Electronics PO-12 and a Korg Minilogue polyphonic analog synthesizer. The two Oxy cuts were also taken from this same live set, themselves ever stranger iterations of the same machines and patches. Mint Gel is a short but sweet bubbly analog braindance track, and (as the title would indicate) Mint Dub manages to reduce it to a shuffle and some reverberated dub spatter. Both of the Mint tracks were generated using the 4x Volcas, Minilogue, Arturia Microbrute, Teenage Electronics PO-12, Korg MS-20 and a Roland SH-32. Finally, the Red Lamp tracks are from a more minimalistic set from late 2017, using only the four Volcas to build up their sequenced psychedelia.
Bismuth Cosmolog will be a simple but funky series of live curiosities and snapshots of moments where the vibrations in the air seemed to be mingling just right. Originating from live recordings means these tracks are best enjoyed very loud on a stereo system with substantial low end output!
Recycled Plastics.credits:
released September 17, 2018
W/P by Brian Grainger. Improvised and recorded live at White Pillar Workshop. Mastered by The Analog Botanist. Design and text by ABM&D. This is Recycled Plastics number COSM02.

Recycled Plastics.title: Blue Machine
Recycled Plastics.label: Milieu Music Digital
Recycled Plastics.about:
AQV returns with a second volume of bedroom electronics, following the first-ever Bedroom Compost release back in 2011. Blue Machine is a textured and mid-fi trip through an aquatic realm, wedged somewhere between the ending sequence from Splash and King Trident's kingdom in The Little Mermaid. Equal parts VHS defocus and analog synthesizer improvisation, Blue Machine conjures up waves and waves of sonic seawater to swim around in, in this ACID SUMMER. Performed live on equipment that all had the color blue present somewhere on its enclosure, with zero computers or overdubs present, direct to a fuzzy cassette tape on an old JVC deck.
Additionally, the limited edition CD-R comes with a special 18-minute bonus track, "A Late One While She's Awake", which features (gasp!) psychedelic electric guitar playing and three-string bass playing by guest Plastician Casio Commander.
Recycled Plastics.credits:
released July 9, 2019
W/P by Brian Grainger. Recorded live at White Pillar, May 13 2017, using the following hardware: Roland SH-32, Boss DR-110, Memphis Blue Beat, Casio MT-210, Moog Ring Modulator, Alesis Quadraverb, Ibanez Phase Modulator, Boss RV-3. Mastered by The Analog Botanist. This is Recycled Plastics number BC77, and #77 in the Bedroom Compost subcatalog.

Recycled Plastics.title: Body Memory
Recycled Plastics.label: Milieu Music Digital
Recycled Plastics.about:
It is with great pleasure and eagerness that Recycled Plastics is able to introduce the listening world to Demi Odessa, a talented young man who has managed to create one of the best Summer albums we've ever heard. BODY MEMORY is notable not only because it is the first RP release to feature vocals, but because it embodies a beautiful confluence of youthful melancholy, seasonal playfulness, lo-fi charm and incredibly measured restraint. Elements of Demi Odessa can be traced all over the place, from warm tape-decked house music to minimal techno, from 1990's trip hop records to classical synthpop - it's all present, natural and unforced. Body Memory sounds easy, accessible and plays to both down and up moods at all the right points, still never letting the curtain pull back so much that we ever get a clear picture of the person behind it.
Keen listeners note: The limited edition CD-R comes with a disc-exclusive bonus track - a Milieu remix of "Don't" that displaces Odessa's lonesome vocals into a SAW 85-92 pool of bittersweetness for night-time cough syrup relaxation...
Recycled Plastics.credits:
released August 13, 2018
W/P by Demi Odessa, except #12: Written by Demi Odessa / Produced & remixed by Milieu. Mastered by The Analog Botanist. Text and design by ABM&D. This is Recycled Plastics number BC70, and 70th in the ongoing Bedroom Compost catalogue.

Recycled Plastics.title: Boredom Composed
Recycled Plastics.label: Milieu Music Digital
Recycled Plastics.about:
As the wizard behind the curtain here at Recycled Plastics, I tend to wear many different hats (wizard-shaped and otherwise), including curator, designer, mastering guru, shipping and fulfillment gopher, on-call remixer, material assembler, copy writer and sarcastic internet shitposter. Beyond all of these, however, I'm living many different lives issuing my own music under more than a dozen different names, in addition to my birthname - some are public, some are...not, but all of them maintain differences in one or more ways.
Until now, there's never been a single release to corral together many of these disparate projects, but BOREDOM COMPOSED attempts to reconcile all of these varied musical profiles I've maintained through the years, and assemble them into a cogent compilation album, inspired by similarly-minded things like GPO's "Jack The Tab" and "Tekno Acid Beat" compilations, Wolfgang Voigt's many releases in this vein at Profan and even things like Basic Channel and Echospace issuing albums with multiple artistic attributions given for the same group of producers. This album is a crossroads, a terminus point where 11 of my different aliases meet each other at a party organized by me, Brian Grainger.
Musically, BOREDOM COMPOSED is a perfect embodiment of many of the genre facets of Recycled Plastics - melodic braindance, bedroom production, sample riffing, dubby techno, jungle spastics and psychedelic ambient passages. Ideally, this is an album that will appeal to everyone, at least momentarily, although it would be a real success to bring together people who may not otherwise buy a ticket to the same show. It is the result of years of work and meticulous organization, an attempt at recording A-side quality tracks for each moniker and still keeping some level of consistency and album flow between them.
So, to send off 2019 with a tip of the many hats I wear, BOREDOM COMPOSED is a fun and heartfelt 90-minute mixtape from my bedroom to yours. Here's to a better year in 2020 - log off, unplug and blissfully ignore with me through these twelve escapist fantasies, because the world outside of our bedrooms? That shit will rot your brain. Life is a beautiful thing, as long as you hold the string.

Recycled Plastics.title: Broken
Recycled Plastics.label: Milieu Music Digital
Recycled Plastics.about: The shadowy figure known as Lamont Kohner returns to Recycled Plastics, after disappearing into a smoky alleyway one night in 2016. He carries with him the new single BROKEN, a classic Kohner cut full of high-pressure bass, monstrous kick drums and dub stabs soaked in greasy city rain. A swirling neon romp that brings to mind equal parts dark dancefloor and film noir detective stories. Backing BROKEN is the equally heavy TENSOR, a hypnotic subway train of metallic rhythms and bass pulse, which passes through the underbelly of the city BROKEN lays claim to, echoing creaks and disembodied voices through pipe systems and black tunnels.
Recycled Plastics.credits:
released August 13, 2018
W/P by Lamont Kohner. Text and design by ABM&D. This is Recycled Plastics number K2, and second in the K subcatalog of Lamont Kohner recordings.

Recycled Plastics.title: Butcher Block Andromeda
Recycled Plastics.label: Milieu Music Digital
Recycled Plastics.about:
Butcher Block Andromeda (graciously christened by Kirk Marrison of Kiln) represents a decade of Milieu music, from its inauguration in May of 2004 to its 10th anniversary celebration in May of 2014. Fifty tracks, carefully selected from dozens of albums, EPs, singles and compilations, lovingly remastered (and in some cases appended for time) to be presented here in this thorough and detailed "beginner's guide". Across the three-disc, four-hour affair, we hear facets of all the various phases Milieu has gone through over the years - from the mid-fi melodies over slow tempos to the house and techno-inflected groovers, from the glitchy atmospheric pieces to the deep ambient odysseys, right on up to present day Milieu, a playful bedroom braindance sound. For both longtime listeners and new recruits, Butcher Block Andromeda should be a fresh and colorful experience of vibrant electronic music, newly minted with a 2014 paint job.
**The digital download also includes seven bonus high-resolution Milieu desktop wallpapers, designed by Eric Adrian Lee.
Recycled Plastics.credits:
released May 17, 2014
Written & produced by Brian Grainger. Recorded at 1027PDS, Foxhill, 114RKD and Botany Bay, various dates 2004-2014. Remastered by The Analog Botanist at Botany Bay, January-April 2014. Album art by Eric Adrian Lee. This is Recycled Plastics number RPMX.
www.milieu-music.com
www.analogbotany.com
www.ericadrianlee.com

Recycled Plastics.title: Combs Hydros
Recycled Plastics.label: Milieu Music Digital
Recycled Plastics.about: Troth arrives at Recycled Plastics with the first of two EPs, Combs Hydros. As you might guess from the sound of the tracks, Troth is none other than Brian Grainger of Milieu/Coppice Halifax. Already one for several monikers and projects, Troth is the representation of Brian's experiments with combining drum machines, a mixer and FX devices with acoustic instruments such as thumb piano, acoustic guitar, metal bowls, bells, recorder and harmonica, among other sampled objects and appliances. The result on Combs Hydros is a very playful melodic braindance effort, although the following EP continues to mutate the sound even further. That said, this EP could be seen as the most traditional Troth will ever sound, providing a point of origin for what will likely be a colorful and confusing ride. Issued on a limited edition of 50 copies in soft plastic cases with orange and red decals.
Recycled Plastics.credits:
released January 24, 2012
W/P by Brian Grainger. Mastered by The Analog Botanist. Recorded at 114RKD and Botany Bay, 2010-2011.

Recycled Plastics.title: Condense
Recycled Plastics.label: Milieu Music Digital
Recycled Plastics.about:
Canvax hails from Enschede, Netherlands, and brings his fresh style of dub, house and electro peppered electronic music to Recycled Plastics with the absolutely essential Condense album. Previously appearing at Body Control and having performed live at Gogbot Festival in 2014, Canvax's music is a glossy minimal techno that seems informed by all sorts of influences, and yet quite unique at the same time. Canvax tracks are sometimes created during a train commute, and the music feels steadily propulsive in the same way, moving at a driving pace through subterranean tunnels and sunny pastoral landscapes.
The limited edition CD-R version contains a bonus remix of "Glide" by Coppice Halifax as an exclusive track.
For the Dutch-speaking among you, check out this neat in-studio interview with the man behind Canvax:  www.youtube.com/watch?v=MJfUdyF1oVo
Recycled Plastics.credits:
released April 20, 2015
W/P by Danny Jeroense. Mastered by The Analog Botanist. This is Recycled Plastics number BC41, and 41st in the Bedroom Compost series.

Recycled Plastics.title: Conference Call, 2013
Recycled Plastics.label: Milieu Music Digital
Recycled Plastics.about: A colorful retrospective sampler of sixteen tracks, carefully selected from the RP catalog. Lovingly sequenced into a vibrant album, and sure to charm and excite electric adults everywhere.
Recycled Plastics.credits:
released May 1, 2013
All tracks written and produced by the credited artists. Mastered by The Analog Botanist. This is Recycled Plastics number RPS1.

Recycled Plastics.title: Conference Call, 2014
Recycled Plastics.label: Milieu Music Digital
Recycled Plastics.about: Sixteen hand-picked files for your consideration and evaluation. 2014 has been a fruitful year for Recycled Plastics, and this Conference Call reflects a diverse portfolio of investments in the braindance and techno areas. To dial in, enter your country code, then press 2-0-1-4. Please enjoy this music while you wait to be connected.
Recycled Plastics.credits:
released November 20, 2014
All tracks written and produced by the credited artists. Mastered and compiled by The Analog Botanist. This is Recycled Plastics number RPS2.

trackinfo.title: The Sixth Gap [Axs Sixth Column Mix]
trackinfo.label: Milieu Music Digital

Recycled Plastics.title: Conference Call, 2015
Recycled Plastics.label: Milieu Music Digital
Recycled Plastics.about: 2015 came and went, and continues to go even now. It was a busy year in Plasticland and this collection of porky prime cuts reflects that. 90 minutes of our finest bedroom compost, digitally delivered to the curvatures of your ears. Where were you in 2002? Just wondering, because it feels like we might still be there now. Could you even tell?
Recycled Plastics.credits:
released December 16, 2015
Written and produced by the credited artists, who are cooler than your school. Mastered and curated by The Analog Botanist. This is Recycled Plastics number RPS3. All blights deserved.

Recycled Plastics.title: Conference Call, 2016
Recycled Plastics.label: Milieu Music Digital
Recycled Plastics.about:
RP wasn't as busy in 2016 as we were in 2015, but with all the political turmoil, obituaries and a tumultuous studio HQ relocation 559 miles away - who could blame us? Still, we certainly put out enough stuff to generate a solid 64 minute sampler for your ear-caressing pleasure. We break it, you buy it. Just make sure to file a report with human resources.
2017 holds many fantastic new releases, with music from Mrs Jynx, Coppice Halifax, Substak, Oxynucid, Orson Throb, Foamek, Face Culler, Yorkshire Modular Society, 801383, Media Them, Lamont Kohner, Mustatunturi, Quiet Yardwork, Arjen Schat, John-Paul Kramer, Solitary Nature, Milieu and still others!
Recycled Plastics.credits:
released January 3, 2017
W/P by the credited artists. Mastered by The Analog Botanist. This is Recycled Plastics number RPS4.

trackinfo.title: Jour Dans La Nuit [Coppice Halifax Assemblage]
trackinfo.label: Milieu Music Digital

Recycled Plastics.title: Conference Call, 2017
Recycled Plastics.label: Milieu Music Digital
Recycled Plastics.about:
Another year, another Plastic sampler for your tired ears! 2017 was a real mindfuck, if you don't mind us saying. We're at the cooler anyway, so who cares? Can we bum a cig?
As is our custom, we have plucked fourteen favorites from last year's releases, which was very painful for us because let's face it, how do you make decisions like this? All of these records are superb and if we did not think so, they wouldn't be here.
There's a good bit of feel-good melodic braindance on show here, which probably says a lot about how badly we needed to feel good last year in the first place. If those don't get the endorphins going, then perhaps some of the more 4/4 techno cuts in the middle will. No? Well, thankfully for you we have just the thing at the end of this set: A wind-down of more restrained ambient techno bleep and bloop.
Okay, looks like my beeper's going off again. Breaktime's over! See you next time - I owe you for that smoke.
Recycled Plastics.credits:
released March 20, 2018
W/P by the credited artists. Principal mastering by The Analog Botanist, except #9 mastered by Tim Gray and #10 mastered by Mustatunturi. Secondary (this compilation) mastering by The Analog Botanist. Design and text by ABM&D. This is Recycled Plastics number RPS5.

Recycled Plastics.title: Conference Call, 2018
Recycled Plastics.label: Milieu Music Digital
Recycled Plastics.about:
2018 came and 2018 went, and then 2019 came, and the RP Corporate Offices sighed a deep and apathetic sigh...and put off the yearly Conference Call until the Winter snow receded and Springtime came bouncing back in with the sunshine. Working from home has never been more appealing.
That said, it should not pass by unnoticed that 2018 was host to many solid singles and full-length albums in the Plastix canon! From the thick minimal techno of Lamont Kohner, Algorithm T and Substak, to the hypermelodic braindance of Foamek and Milieu, and even deeper still with dub techno from Brother Blue and Orson Throb. Somewhere between all of it was unique stuff like Demi Odessa's sad bedroom techno pop tracks, Blaubac's modular synthesizer excursions, Bike's Skammy hardware improvisations and Occur's mentalist digital whorls of sound. Recycled Plastics continues its charted path of doing whatever feels good, even when it has already been done.
2019 already holds many other excellent releases from alumni such as Lamont Kohner, Parallelism, Milieu, Foamek and others...plus new and exciting work by Dusklark, other_Format, Volitune and a few more surprises we don't want to mention yet. Ramble on!
Recycled Plastics.credits:
released May 5, 2019
Written & produced by the credited artists. Mastered by The Analog Botanist, except #2/5/9 mastered by the artists themselves. Design and text by ABM&D. This is Recycled Plastics number RPS6. Thanks for calling.

Recycled Plastics.title: Constance Dubs
Recycled Plastics.label: Milieu Music Digital
Recycled Plastics.about: Grey Deer is one Carl Ritger, sonic wizard, dweller of Colorado and perhaps better known as Radere. Constance Dubs is the debut release under his Grey Deer moniker, and fittingly so as it was recorded during the very early days of Carl's musical maturation. Three longform pieces that might surprise Radere fans with their light but propulsive rhythm sections, Constance Dubs is a completely different kind of dub techno album. Steady kickdrums, hi hats and percussive taps are built entirely from field recordings, and the atmosphere around them is a foggy forest of guitars and debris. Very warm, wooden and seemingly wrested from beneath the roots of a mighty oak tree, Constance Dubs is an easily accessible unification of both ambient and techno sensibilities.
Recycled Plastics.credits:
released January 24, 2012
Written and produced by Carl Ritger. Mastered by The Analog Botanist. This is Recycled Plastics number BC3. Third in the ongoing Bedroom Compost series.

Recycled Plastics.title: Cybertone
Recycled Plastics.label: Milieu Music Digital
Recycled Plastics.about: Cybertone's debut self-titled album is a bouncy work of melodic bedroom electronics and tight, funky grooves. These tracks were made lovingly with the cozy classic sounds of an 808 and 303, singing harmoniously together, with an added dose of glossy neon funk and concise software cut-ups. Cybertone is a charming young man named Mike from Ontario and since his debut album is so special and cool, Milieu and Mrs Jynx stepped in and did some remixes for it. Cybertone is completely free, so there's really no reason you shouldn't check this out - a braindance excursion awaits!
Recycled Plastics.credits:
released June 19, 2012
W/P by Cybertone, except #12: written by Cybertone and remixed/produced by Mrs Jynx, and #13: written by Cybertone and remixed/produced by Milieu. Mastered by The Analog Botanist. This is Bedroom Compost number BC9.

Recycled Plastics.title: [Cycle A]
Recycled Plastics.label: Milieu Music Digital
Recycled Plastics.about:
Parallelism, otherwise known as aspect./Sage Taylor and previously known as Textural Being, hails from the Pacific northwest. His debut for Recycled Plastics is the first of several scheduled installments in his own newly-minted subcatalogue, which simply bears the label P. Unlike the ambient house of aspect. or the dub techno of Textural Being (see: BC30 / The Sixth Gap, Textural Being's final release), Taylor's work as Parallelism covers a broader spectrum of ambient and drone music, warm glitch and reduced minimalistic dub. To our ears, this is fresh, vibrant music, truly organic and electronic at the same time, and easily inhabits a world preceded by giants like GAS, Vladislav Delay, Pole and Variant. A feast for the ears and the (closed) eyes, intimate and gentle.
The Parallelism subcatalogue will continue with limited edition cassettes, possibly with CD-R punctuations at key points.
Recycled Plastics.credits:
released March 28, 2017
W/P by Sage Taylor. Mastering and cover design by The Analog Botanist. Photography by Brian Grainger. This is Recycled Plastics number P / / 1, and first in the Parallelism subcatalogue.

Recycled Plastics.title: Delectro
Recycled Plastics.label: Milieu Music Digital
Recycled Plastics.about: Pierre Delecto is the newest addition to a massive roster of artists who deal in heavy, melted Plastix, hailing from the Auvergne in France. His debut release, DELECTRO, immediately brings to mind the fat analog bounce of Kompakt barnburners, as well as things like Plastikman and Gescom - guaranteed to shake speakers in a club set. Pierre doesn't seem to like super clean mixes, preferring instead analog drumcomputers, synthesizers and tape, and as such DELECTRO fits in at Recycled Plastics as a sort of noisier, nastier counterpart to the Lamont Kohner singles or Ndru's minimal techno masterstroke Knospensprung (see: BC15). And we can indeed say with some authority that Pierre has been a nasty, naughty boy.
Recycled Plastics.credits:
released January 30, 2020
W/P by Pierre Delecto. Recorded in France, 2019. Mastered by The Analog Botanist. Text and design by ABM&D. This is Recycled Plastics number BC83, and 83rd in the ongoing Bedroom Compost series.

Recycled Plastics.title: Desert Trax
Recycled Plastics.label: Milieu Music Digital
Recycled Plastics.about: Grand Canyon Spring Breaks debuts at RP with the excellent bedroom odyssey Desert Trax. GCSB is a man of many names, we know him as Hugo, but some of you may know him as the mind behind Ravadiscs in France. The hardware-led tangents and tape warmth present on excellent releases like Aqualog and Atlantic Technologies are all present here, with twelve tracks created live using the Ensoniq Mirage eight-bit sampler from 1985, recorded in mono direct to an Akai tape machine with no overdubs (but a good bit of editing to tighten things up in post). Musically, Desert Trax recalls a lot of our favorite moments from labels like Rephlex, Spymania, Clear and Skam - the sort of classic heyday of bedroom electronicists with their machines all sprawled out on a dingy carpet, wires everywhere, plinking and plonking their way through handmade futurism, one sequencer step at a time. It retains all of the rugged and raw elemental aspects of having come from a single live take on only one low-bitrate machine, but to our ears, feels all the more comfortable and authentic for it. Hugo sent music to the RP PO box years earlier, and due to a comedy of errors, where his work went to the wrong address after we relocated, it took a little while to connect...but, we finally aligned our signal paths and are happily able to now bring some of his excellent recordings to your ears. We might be inclined to say "Better late than never" if the music didn't sound so timeless and interesting, and Desert Trax is right on time for what our ears need to hear at the end of a long and exhausting year.
Recycled Plastics.credits:
released November 6, 2020
W/P by Hugo S. Recorded live in France using an Ensoniq Mirage (1985), laid to tape direct from the Mirage in high-fidelity mono with an Akai tape machine. No bounces, lots of editing. Text and design by ABM&D. This is Recycled Plastics number BC88. Grand Canyon Spring Breaks appears courtesy of Ravadiscs:  ravadiscs.bandcamp.com

Recycled Plastics.title: Dim Sokette
Recycled Plastics.label: Milieu Music Digital
Recycled Plastics.about: Dim Sokette comes to us from an anonymous donor, much in the same way records like Edith Keeler's Harness have. These kinds of releases, where the authorship is left ambiguous, are fascinating because it forces the listener to focus only on what's there in the music. The tracks akrenaut produced bring to mind many fantastic aspects of other music from the past - elements of early Rephlex and Artificial Intelligence-era Warp, the early melodic phases of Ten and Tracer, the somber pads of Fieldtriqp and Christ., the skittering rhythmic programming of early AE, and more, all seem to be referenced here. Whether that's intended, or just a part of the DNA that makes Dim Sokette do what it does, is unknown, and ultimately irrelevant. It feels good - no, great - and it really makes the management here at RP proud to receive records of this caliber in the mailbox, just out of thin air. The only personal touches that seem to be obvious on Dim Sokette are bits of human dialogue that burble in and out of focus on certain tracks, and even a sampled cat meow and purr. akrenaut, whoever they are, are content to ride emotive waves through a very comfortable, homemade environment, and it gives Dim Sokette a nice sense of placement. For every eyebrow-raising chord change or curious bit of processing we hear, there are twice as many moments that feel carefully assembled and completely unique to someone's palette. A lovely release to coincide with Foamek's recent romp in the Autumn leaves, and a solid contribution to the growing RP catalog.
Recycled Plastics.credits:
released November 12, 2017
W/P by akrenaut. Mastered by The Analog Botanist. This is Recycled Plastics number BC61, and 61st in the Bedroom Compost catalog.

Recycled Plastics.title: Dissident
Recycled Plastics.label: Milieu Music Digital
Recycled Plastics.about: Lamont Kohner is Patrick Benolkin, currently residing in Boise, Idaho, and possibly better known to many of you by the names Electricwest or Eluder. So far, Lamont Kohner has only issued one album - Willamette Dubs, at the ever-loving Wil Ru Records - which our very own Analog Botanist mastered and curated a second disc of remixes for. Lamont has not stayed inactive since that release, rather, he has grown a rather large catalog of unreleased works intended as singles, and what better place to issue them than here at Recycled Plastics? So, with absolutely no hesitation, we set the man up with his own catalog (K, for those still wondering) wherein we will steadily drip out Lamont Kohner's singles, stopping occasionally along the way to collect them into special limited edition CD-R collections with extra tracks. Opening the gates for the new catalog is Dissident, a monochromatic techno rock climber of a track, doing what Lamont Kohner does best, which is slowly filling the room with steam until it's ready to explode, and then deploying state of the art depressurization techniques that masquerade as rusting chord shapes swinging around your center of gravity like a carousel. In short, this is high-pressure music for high fidelity systems, and these tracks will not let you forget this. Be careful, stay safe and enjoy!
Recycled Plastics.credits:
released March 10, 2016
W/P by Patrick Benolkin. Mastered by The Analog Botanist. Cover design by Ginger Aribarn. This is Recycled Plastics number K1. Now stop reading this and fuck off to that play button up there.

Recycled Plastics.title: Dropper
Recycled Plastics.label: Milieu Music Digital
Recycled Plastics.about:
Dropper is the second EP released by Occur, issued out of chronological sequence due to the fact that it was recorded and subsequently released in August, 2017 for an emergency charity compilation, to raise money for hurricane and flood victims in Houston TX. Here, it finally sees physical issue, and a place in the OCR catalog proper.
Musically, Dropper bears some likenesses to Occur recordings that are not yet released - namely Topo (OCR5) and Range (OCR6) - in that it explores the band's more braindance side, with warbling acid lines, warm drum machine bounce and majestic analog synthesizer passages, doused in reverb. Dropper is the kind of recording that might have been found in a pile of lost DATs at Rephlex or Warp in the early to mid-nineties - emotive and spacious, while also remaining very rhythmic and dancefloor appropriate.
Like all Occur releases, Dropper was improvised live on a mostly analog hardware setup, without overdubs or computers. While this release exists in the Recycled Plastics OCR catalog, the band also maintains their own catalog at  opacitycontrastresolution.bandcamp.com
Additionally, an ambient distillation/expansion of Dropper will be released as DOE at sister-label Psoma Psi Phi.
Recycled Plastics.credits:
released February 11, 2018
W/P by Brian Grainger & John-Paul Kramer. Performed and recorded live at White Pillar Workshop, August 2017, using Korg Volca Bass / Beats / Keys, Akai XR-20 and Yamaha RY-20, in conjunction with Alesis Quadraverb / BBE Two Timer / Boss RV-3 / Pioneer SR202W and a Peavey FX2x24 mixing desk. Mastered by The Analog Botanist, September 2017. Design and logo by ABM&D. This is Recycled Plastics number OCR2.

Recycled Plastics.title: Drum
Recycled Plastics.label: Milieu Music Digital
Recycled Plastics.about:
Drum is the debut release by Occur, a collaborative effort between Brian Grainger (Milieu, Coppice Halifax, etc) and John-Paul Kramer (COAL, Casio Commander, etc). This christening work follows a live remixing collaboration on the Coppice Halifax release Okazi [Enkorpigita] (that's Esperanto for Occur [Embodied]), issued as part of CH's Deep Earth series:  malfokusita.bandcamp.com/album/okazi-enkorpigita
Musically, Occur exists as a proper collaboration should - live, in the moment, unplanned and improvised on a wide array of analog and digital synthesizers, drum machines, outboard FX and laboratory equipment. As such, Occur affairs tend to be tangential and sporadic across long-form runtimes, which are filled with bright prisms of color, dimly lit corners and everything in between. Taking influences from classic works by Aphex Twin, AE/Gescom, Pan Sonic and other early 1990s electronics, as well as more modern trailblazers such as Demdike Stare and Omit, Occur attempts to use both vintage and modern approaches to studio performance in an immediate and impulse-driven way.
On Drum, this wide range of styles is funneled into two tracks of rugged, heavy techno that themselves unfurl and melt away into ambient pools of imagined raindrops. Using a DJ turntable with such vinyl sources as African tribesmen, opera music, piano etudes and political lecturers from the 1960s, these sounds are heavily manipulated in realtime and played alongside a studio rig built for dub techno session work by Coppice Halifax (who was using the studio at the time). Indeed, Occur's initial session was something that simply materialized organically on its own, by virtue of both parties being present at that point in space and time. Occur literally just happened.
At present, there are already three to four subsequent Occur releases in hand, which are currently being mixed down and mastered. As Occur's artistic philosophy aligns strongly with Recycled Plastics' own mission, it only made sense to create the OCR subcatalog expressly for the band. Physical editions of Drum (and the following OCR releases) are forthcoming, pending materials needed to produce such editions. All physical versions will be exclusively available at Occur's own Bandcamp page here:  opacitycontrastresolution.bandcamp.com
Recycled Plastics.credits:
released August 18, 2017
W/P by Brian Grainger & John-Paul Kramer. Recorded live at White Pillar Workshop, March 2017, using the following equipment: Korg ER-1 / Grass C-TCM / Gemini PDT-6000 / Behringer US600 / Boss RV-3 / Boss SL-20 / Moog LPF + Ringmod + MIDI MuRF / Alesis Quadraverb / Pioneer S202W / Digitech Synth Wah / Peavey FX2x24. Mastering & design by The Analog Botanist. This is Recycled Plastics number OCR1.

Recycled Plastics.title: Dusk Requisite
Recycled Plastics.label: Milieu Music Digital
Recycled Plastics.about: The fifth single in Lamont Kohner's ongoing catalog, "Dusk Requisite" offers a more subdued dub techno atmosphere that eventually opens up under the weight of a watertight bass drum. B-side "Hollow" recalls the greasy city streets that are never very far away from any LK tracks, with the sounds of a subway rave heard through the pipes and grates on the sidewalk, locomotive rhythms echoing the train tunnels themselves, before stepping aside to plant more resonant chords like seeds in the slick asphalt itself.
Recycled Plastics.credits:
released November 6, 2020
W/P by Lamont Kohner. This is Recycled Plastics number K5.

Recycled Plastics.title: Dusk Versions
Recycled Plastics.label: Milieu Music Digital
Recycled Plastics.about: As a final sendoff for the 2011 year, the appropriately titled Dusk Versions appears as RP2 at Recycled Plastics. Recorded during the same time as the material for both Outward Residence and Parallel Harbors (at Other Heights, Belgium), but much softer and more catered to night time listening. Quiet, restrained rhythms bounce and sway in the background of a dark sonic ether, fogged by the repetitive layers of smoky chords and short melodic stabs punctuating the groove. Variations and refractions of delays twinkle and bubble like living sparks that decorate corners of the room too dark to see. Minimal notes of bass anchor the tracks with submarine propulsion, and sheets of translucent tape warmth and analog reverb are laid gently over the whole structure. This album is an exercise in finality, in closure. The end of another year, and the last appearance of the oft revisited track Dusk, with the minor exception of a remix album due out in 2012 at Other Heights, featuring Quantec, Grad_U, Ohrwert, Axs, Zzzzra and Textural Being.
Recycled Plastics.credits:
released December 16, 2011
W/P by Coppice Halifax. Mastered by The Analog Botanist. Recorded at 114RKD, Spring-Summer 2010. This is Recycled Plastics number RP2.

Recycled Plastics.title: Dusklark
Recycled Plastics.label: Milieu Music Digital
Recycled Plastics.about:
Hailing from sunburnt San Diego, waves of sad magic are emanating up like heat off a hot street, and bittersweet blue-skies flow through the eponymous album by DUSKLARK. We haven't done a record like this in some time at RP, and by "like this" we mean that very unique, warm and cozy bedroom electronic music that lives inside mid-fi cassette ranges and muted melancholy. Think early Milieu, Freescha's "Kids Fill The Floor", Ten and Tracer, pre-breaks Mike P and the textured downsample-crunch of Casino Versus Japan, all bundled up in a breezy lite-house vehicle that makes effective use of electro-tinted drum machines like the 808 and HR16 alongside plainsung sine tone basslines and wobblyheaded melodies bubbling over all corners like citrus Summertime orange soda pop. Introspective music for outdoorsy park walkers, headphone micro-symphonix and smart house grooves that fit into the gloved hand of a drowsy-eyed DJ set in the parking lot of a 24-hour sushi bar. DUSKLARK has arrived, and he'll be taking the sunshine back with him when he goes. Get some before it's all gone...
**TIP**: The limited edition CD-R is jam-packed with 63 minutes of Dusklark, including 10 (!!!) bonus tracks only included on the disk, one of which is a downer night-bus ride back home - the 9-minute Coppice Halifax BLUE PAYPHONE remix!
Recycled Plastics.credits:
released September 24, 2019
W/P by Dusklark. Mastered by The Analog Botanist. Text and design by ABM&D. This is Recycled Plastics number BC80, and 80th in the Bedroom Compost subcatalog. (C) + (P) Dusklark 2019. All nights reversed.

Recycled Plastics.title: Echoate
Recycled Plastics.label: Milieu Music Digital
Recycled Plastics.about:
Zander One hails from Ohio, and brings Recycled Plastics his lovingly crafted first full-length work Echoate. Echoate is absolutely everything you could want to cuddle up with during the colder months when Autumn transitions into Winter - deep throbs of warm basslines, simple buoyant kickdrums and beautiful synth chords that seem to slowly melt like ice under a gentle orange sun. Reminding us, at times, of what it could be like if Yagya and Seefeel produced a dub techno album together, Zander One goes a step further and defines all of his signature elements minimally and efficiently. Echoate is a work that is presented with zero filler - only carrying with it the essentials needed to work the formula's magic. Anyone who enjoys deep and cozy electronic music will be sorely missing out if they pass this by! One of the best records RP has heard all year by anyone!
In addition to the free 8-track album, you can buy a limited edition CD-R with two bonus tracks (Full Moon / Endless Rain) and a Coppice Halifax remix** of Iceberg!
**Brian had such a good time remixing Iceberg that he actually produced three Coppice Halifax remixes. You can buy all three on the Blue Shape 3" CD-R EP here:
store.milieu-music.com/index.php?route=product/product&path=69&product_id=143
For a limited time, the Milieu Music shop has also made a package deal of Echoate & Blue Shape available together for a discounted price here:
store.milieu-music.com/index.php?route=product/product&path=69&product_id=145
Recycled Plastics.credits:
released November 12, 2012
Written and produced by Zander One. Mastered by The Analog Botanist at Botany Bay, November 2012. This is Recycled Plastics number BC12, and twelfth in the ongoing Bedroom Compost series.

Recycled Plastics.title: Echonine
Recycled Plastics.label: Milieu Music Digital
Recycled Plastics.about: Echonine is the aptly titled remix album for 2012's ambient techno odyssey Echoate, although upon closer inspection, it also contains remixes of tracks that weren't actually on Echoate. Echonine is half what you might expect from a Zander One release - distant foggy pads and sublime warm basslines over soft rhythms that aren't in a hurry to get anywhere - and half some other beast entirely, taking notes from Autechre/Gescom on the Entorwellian and Zwei Kreise mixes, and even channeling some warped Dilla-esque hip hop on the QBLA remix. On paper, it seems like it won't work, but listening proves otherwise, and the compilation closes with "Seaswept", a beautiful previously unreleased track. Echonine is a colorful and varied collection of tracks that should whet the appetite of listeners eager for a new ZO full-length album. The good news is: one is shortly on the way, due out at the lovely WR label in Portland in the coming months. Until then, enjoy Echonine!
Recycled Plastics.credits:
released October 20, 2013
Tracks #1-8, written by Zander One and produced/remixed by the credited artists. Track #9 W/P by Zander One. Mastered and sequenced by The Analog Botanist at Botany Bay, Autumn 2013. This is Recycled Plastics number BC26 and 26th in the ongoing Bedroom Compost series.

Recycled Plastics.title: Egret's Crystal
Recycled Plastics.label: Milieu Music Digital
Recycled Plastics.about: Before filling the RP post office box with happiness, NN* has enjoyed a fruitful career as a mushroom parachute repairman in the distant foreign land of En'entopia, and he's won numerous awards for his magically delicious music. He currently holds the Forestry Division title for most colorful sidewalk chalk art, and he's been elected the Relay Tagmaster three times in a row by the Recycled Pastels Committee. At summer camps, he is always voted Best Chaperone and even after a long day's work monitoring mountain stream temperatures, he still has time to unwind with his synthesizers and watercolors (ladies, take note: he can knob twiddle and portrait paint at the same time!). Thankfully for us at RP, NN* has gifted a true bounty of melodies, overflowing with headnodding oak-tree rhythms, bass stabs played by Jawas and luscious reverbs from Mordor's deepest caverns. As if the album we're giving to you for free isn't amazing enough, there's more - a limited edition CD-R with FOUR bonus NN* tracks and TWO pastoral remixes by MILIEU and MRS JYNX. Zap!
Recycled Plastics.credits:
released April 12, 2013
W/P by Nathaniel Nichols. Sequenced and mastered by The Analog Botanist. This is Recycled Plastics number BC16, and number 16 in the ongoing Bedroom Compost series.

Recycled Plastics.title: Evergreen Secrets
Recycled Plastics.label: Milieu Music Digital
Recycled Plastics.about: Axs continues his 'Secrets' trilogy of unreleased works from the archives of past years with Evergreen Secrets, an even more groove-oriented set of tracks than Rosewood's subdued technoid forms. Pulsing shapes of dub chords and restrained minimal techno sensibilities allow Axs the space needed to organically explore a colorful landscape of sound, all while buoyant drum machine work and utilitarian bass continually anchor his deep compositions. Gracefully mastered by The Analog Botanist to ensure continuity between recordings that are often years apart, and lovingly represented as a very special addition to the Recycled Plastics catalog. Stay tuned for the third and final volume, Midnight Secrets, in 2014...
Recycled Plastics.credits:
released December 21, 2013
W/P by Axs. Mastered by The Analog Botanist, November-December 2013 at Botany Bay. This is Recycled Plastics number BC25B, and 25Bth in the ongoing Bedroom Compost series.

Recycled Plastics.title: F^vex
Recycled Plastics.label: Milieu Music Digital
Recycled Plastics.about:
F^vex, the first new recorded effort by Vhom since 2010's guitar drone monument Firmamvnt, is a sprawling set of intense electronics. Taking obvious notes from things like Autechre, Pan Sonic and BRTLMN, with perhaps less-obvious nods to Aube, Omit, Throbbing Gristle and Vladislav Delay, this EP was created using several pieces of incongruous gear in tandem with unique things like reel to reel tape loops, buzzing devices that have been fed too much voltage and broken FX boxes. F^vex is techno music that has been literally broken down and recycled, with tiny bits of recognizable pieces appearing in an otherwise tangled and incomprehensible sonic landscape. Even the track titles allude more to compressed data than to anything resembling language. A perfect piece of bedroom compost for the Bedroom Compost series!
There is also an additional ten-minute track on the CD-R version, for those of you who enjoy the feel of a lovingly stickered recycled cardboard square in your hands, especially one that contains a circular readable data disc that is compatible with your home machines!
Recycled Plastics.credits:
released June 20, 2012
W/P by Brian Grainger. Recorded at ### with ### and ### during the summer of ###. This is Recycled Plastics number BC10, and tenth in the Bedroom Compost series.

Recycled Plastics.title: Facks Tracs #1a
Recycled Plastics.label: Milieu Music Digital
Recycled Plastics.about: The first of a series of four Bike EPs, the first new material since 2011's Flanger/Rector EP set. Mutant, sprawling electronics built using the DJ-tool album Halifaxian (by Coppice Halifax) in conjunction with analog and digital processing, equipment and software. Gritty and funky synthetic grooves covered in waves of undulating sonic detritus, with obvious influences from Autechre, Pan Sonic and to a lesser degree, Throbbing Gristle.

W/P by Bike. Recorded at 114RKD, 2010. Mastered by The Analog Botanist. This is Recycled Plastics number FAX1A.

Recycled Plastics.title: Flax Harmonade
Recycled Plastics.label: Milieu Music Digital
Recycled Plastics.about: Flax Harmonade is a collaborative project between Brian Grainger and Lee Batchelor, themselves better known as Milieu and Scup Bucket. This album was their first and only release, recorded between 2004 and 2006, and released on a limited edition CD-R at U-Cover in Belgium in Autumn of 2006. Influenced by all manner of playful braindance and classic bedroom electronic music such as early Aphex, Global Goon, Ovuca, the Mike & Rich album and Cylob, among many others, Flax Harmonade is closer to the acidy melodic dance music of Milieu's Polypsilon or Academy Stripes, and was fairly out of character with his audience in 2006. As such, the FH album went somewhat under the radar of many fans, and even now we're betting that many of you have never even heard of it. So, retrieved from the dusty vaults, a weird, funky, catchy and exciting album is once again available via Recycled Plastics. Enjoy!
Recycled Plastics.credits:
released April 10, 2015
W/P by Brian Grainger and Lee Batchelor. Recorded in South Carolina and Maine, 2004-2006. Mastered by The Analog Botanist, 2006. This is Recycled Plastics number BC40, and 40th in the Bedroom Compost catalog. Special thanks to Koen for originally releasing our weird album, and kindly allowing us to reissue it with Recycled Plastics.

Recycled Plastics.title: Fugue State Phases
Recycled Plastics.label: Milieu Music Digital
Recycled Plastics.about:
Privately commissioned in 2013, Fugue State Phases has collected digital dust for four years now. Recording sessions began with the express intent to return to the 'classic' Milieu sound, circa 2005-2006, following the example of albums like Slow Lid Close and Our Blue Rainbow. To do this, I went to great lengths in order to use the exact same setups and FX that I used back then, and worked for several months to attempt to get back to that very specific headspace, compositionally. I'm not absolutely certain that I succeeded in my charge, but considering how much material I create, even the distance of a year is like centuries apart, in terms of forward movement in my work. In any case, the results are quite melodic, funky and a little bent in that very specific detuned way all of the earlier Milieu music was. The astute listener will recognize certain drum breaks, bass, organ and synthesizer sounds and other ephemera that appeared all over the earlier Milieu output. A possible past, perhaps from a different Brian Grainger in a different timeline - where instead of Slow Lid Close, this might have existed in its place.
Today, I'm releasing this publicly to aid Bandcamp's charity drive for the Transgender Law Center, on August 4, wherein they will donate 100% of their share. Some of my biggest musical influences are transgender or gender-queer artists, and their equal rights, happiness and well-being mean a lot to me. So buy a record, get some music, help me and help others in need - everybody wins.
daily.bandcamp.com/2017/07/31/this-friday-stand-with-bandcamp-in-support-of-trans-rights/
**Editor's note: All track titles for this album were conceived by the person who commissioned the work. I do not know the people they name or the situations they reference. In this way, the work maintains a personal connection to the curator, while simultaneously being a public work for everyone to draw their own conclusions with.
Recycled Plastics.credits:
released September 1, 2017
W/P by Brian Grainger. Recorded at Botany Bay, 2013 for private commission. Mastered by The Analog Botanist. Issued with thanks to K.F. Photography by Rudolf Kremers, used with gracious permission. This is Recycled Plastics number RP9.
