Recycled Plastics.title: Giehkirnjarga
Recycled Plastics.label: Milieu Music Digital
Recycled Plastics.about:
Mustatunturi is a mysterious artist who hails from Russia, and has been producing music for a very long time - this is nearly all we know. He informed us of his being inspired by living in the Far North, snow, ice and the polar lights of the Rybachy Peninsula, from which the title of this work is derived. Sometimes, however, as many other RP releases have proven, knowing less about the artist and their intentions only serves to place the focus completely on the music. So, on BC58, what do we hear?
Deep, dimly lit soundfields that seem to recall minimal electronic works from Robert Hood, Plastikman and certain Chain Reaction wax. Driving grooves anchor a glistening, lonely city filled with silhouettes of industrial structures and streetlamps that only seem to illuminate the lazily falling slanted rain and detritus. There is a cold distance at play here, between artist and listener - a deliberate wall, beyond which sits a void that longs for human touch but never quite knows how to accomplish it.
Many elements of Giehkirnjarga are classic drum machine and synthesizer sounds from all eras of techno records, and in this way, the album feels as if it is not quite modern, but a recently unearthed archival recording from twenty years ago. A perfect passenger for night drives and oily neon sign-lit bar windows, leather seats and voyeuristic Polaroids...longing and self-imposed exile.
Recycled Plastics.credits:
released August 29, 2017
W/P by Mustatunturi. Mastering by Mustatunturi. This album is dedicated to the Saami people of northern Finland, Russia and Norway. This is Recycled Plastics number BC58, and 58th in the ongoing Bedroom Compost catalog.

Recycled Plastics.title: Green Cloud
Recycled Plastics.label: Milieu Music Digital
Recycled Plastics.about:
After his wildly well-received Royal Secret single, Tim Gray brings us the first full-length album as Brother Blue: Green Cloud. Melodic stabs, hazy pads and rumbling bass are the order of the day with Green Cloud. Faithful to the staples of the dub techno sound, but not afraid to get a bit textural and gritty as well. Rough in all the right spots, yet still soft enough to invite you in, Green Cloud is a superb near-80 minute jaunt through Tim's stylish production approach. A rich techno record just in time for the humidity of Spring!
The limited edition CD-R comes with two exclusive bonus tracks: "Fireface" and "Endtimes"
Recycled Plastics.credits:
released March 24, 2015
W/P by Tim Gray. Mastered by The Analog Botanist. This is Recycled Plastics number BC38, and 38th in the Bedroom Compost series.

Recycled Plastics.title: Hand Sines
Recycled Plastics.label: Milieu Music Digital
Recycled Plastics.about: As if in a lucid dream, or an echo of some previous life, you open a door to a small house in a quiet urban neighborhood. A single streetlamp draws a lazy line across your back as you enter the home, and you seem to float through the entryway, bodiless. Your camera eye weaves slowly through the empty livingroom, casually scanning cheap furniture, a VCR from the 1980s and an answering machine with an ominous, blinking red light. You glide silently into a hallway, and veer slightly right to arrive in a dim bedroom. A saggy mattress slumps onto a black metal frame, covered in mussed red sheets, and flanked on both sides by small wooden end tables. On one, you see a digital clock with the time blinking an incessant 3:33. On the other, a weathered copy of a paperback next to an ashtray. Your gaze narrows to read the title - "Die Schlafende Erde", with a photograph of an empty rural road on the cover. Just then, a small sound, and the faint movement of curtains in the corner. A window is open, and a small breeze blows into the room like a whispered secret, bringing with it the incense of a hot summer night, baked on cricket legs and cicada shells. You get the urge to reach your arms out, and down, perhaps to put your hand to your chest in pensive consideration, but nothing happens. A second sense of voyeuristic powerlessness washes over you, and from the darkened passage behind you, a door opens.
Recycled Plastics.credits:
released October 5, 2017
W/P by AAA QQQ. Mastered by The Analog Botanist. This is Recycled Plastics number BC60, and 60th in the Bedroom Compost series.

Recycled Plastics.title: Harness
Recycled Plastics.label: Milieu Music Digital
Recycled Plastics.about: One of the most interesting demos to arrive in the Recycled Plastics post office box is this 47 minute romp through bouncy techno and Rephlexian electronics from one Edith Keeler - no return address, no additional information beyond a typewritten message asking RP to release it, and for any money made with the album to help furnish future RP releases. As it happens, Harness hits all the right spots for something in the RP catalog - massive club-friendly basslines and kicks, wobbly melodies, space cadet pads and swirling hi-hats with lots of technical edits everywhere. We have no idea what kind of hardware or software was employed to make these tracks, and frankly, we don't care. When the music is this satisfying, it could be coming out of a kazoo and we'd never blink an eye. Perhaps this is what Edith Keeler (whoever she or he really is) is trying to accomplish with this album - a focus on the music alone, with zero pretext and nothing else to prop it up besides what comes out of the speakers. Either way, we hope Edith continues to ping our PO box in the future.
Recycled Plastics.credits:
released July 19, 2016
W/P by ???. Lightly mastered by The Analog Botanist. This is Recycled Plastics number BC49, and 49th in the Bedroom Compost catalog.

Recycled Plastics.title: Hermetic Peaks
Recycled Plastics.label: Milieu Music Digital
Recycled Plastics.about:
Bovaflux is a talented young man named Eddie from the United Kingdom. By day, Eddie works on video games (such as this year's excellent Elite: Dangerous) and by night (and also probably by day too, now that we think about it) he coaxes lovely warm melodies and bleepy drumlines from his studio. Reminding us of things like early Bochum Welt, Artificial Intelligence and the more optimistic sounding records in the Toytronic catalog, Hermetic Peaks is a colourful and varied stroll through many of the best things about electronic music from the last ten years, carefully and considerably placed on display like statues in a garden or paintings in a hall, each burbling with sonic character and synthesized funk that just won't quit. Bovaflux is a welcome addition to the growing Recycled Plastics family, with a perfect record for keeping cool in the summer sun.
There is a limited edition CD-R version of BC42, which includes two bonus tracks and a special Milieu remix!
Recycled Plastics.credits:
released July 22, 2015
W/P by Eddie Symons. Mastered by The Analog Botanist. This is Recycled Plastics number BC42, and 42nd in the Bedroom Compost series.

Recycled Plastics.title: Housewares
Recycled Plastics.label: Milieu Music Digital
Recycled Plastics.about: It seems that Shallow Earth's shadow extends further than I might have expected, because this is a new stash of trax that sort of embody the palette of RP11, albeit with a bit more of a house music and occasionally acidic bend. Somewhere between a long EP and a short album, Housewares consists of eight cuts of Milieu dance music in varying degrees of ADHD, sometimes content to cruise with the windows down and others, ready to burst through the nightclub wall with a bass assault. Influences should be somewhat obvious - AFX, Norken, Underworld, DJ Sprinkles, cv313, Cylob, Russ Gabriel, Magic Arrows, among lots of other stuff. Housewares is for the late night feel good and the early morning feel bad...or is it the other way around? I can barely keep the days of the week straight here in my basement, so these jams may be a little frayed around the edges, but they mean well. Hugs and high fives.
Recycled Plastics.credits:
released May 1, 2020
W/P by Brian Grainger. Recorded at the Workshop, Spring 2020. Mastered by The Analog Botanist. Text and design by ABM&D. Photography by Anni Roenkae, used with gracious permission. This is Recycled Plastics number RP14.

Recycled Plastics.title: Ice Forest
Recycled Plastics.label: Milieu Music Digital
Recycled Plastics.about:
A Halifaxian interpretation of the cold ending of the year, and something to smear your brain across while the temperatures drop. Produced in the older style of Coppice Halifax records, with full compressor abuse to the point of textural overload, and inspired in equal parts by drone-techno fellows Submersion and Mon0, and the transmutation of the cold itself into sonic tapestry.
The limited edition CD-R version contains the bonus 40+ minute piece "Ice Forest [Melted]", to warm your insides back up after traversing the immense and formidable Ice Forest.
Recycled Plastics.credits:
released December 1, 2014
W/P by Brian Grainger. Recorded at Botany Bay, November 2014. Mastered by The Analog Botanist. This is Recycled Plastics number BC31, and 31st in the ongoing Bedroom Compost series.

Recycled Plastics.title: Index
Recycled Plastics.label: Milieu Music Digital
Recycled Plastics.about:
Substak returns to Recycled Plastics for his third release in our Bedroom Compost series - a feat only held by two other artists currently (Zander One and Axs) - although INDEX is sure to be anything but Substak's final word on our imprint.
Having traversed abstract rhythmic pulses on Beatless, and low-frequency submersible exploration on No Sense, Index sees Substak at perhaps his most straightforward at RP, employing minimal techno propulsion that recalls things like Reinhard Voigt's Pentax alias at Profan, Basic Channel and some of the weirder things at Rephlex. While rhythm is the focus of Index, Substak uses it almost melodically, presenting sections of drum programming that are tangled up in knots, as other tracks feel as if they are physical vessels that Substak is slowly filling with pitch-altering chemicals. Aspects of Index can be found in other Substak records, but (as usual for his work) this release feels like a microscoping zooming-in of a small curve or shadow on a much larger universe of sound. More like a study of a singular object, rather than a summation of multiple ideas. Substak's sound is in constant motion, and yet feels incredibly focused and deliberate - careful, even - across tracks whose modest runtimes trick the ears into blissful massage and hypnosis, giving the impression of exceptionally longer pieces.
**Dedicated listeners would be wise to pick up the limited edition CD-R of Index, which includes two additional Substak cuts (Index 1.7 & 1.8) that introduce acid lines over the percussive establishment of the first six Index tracks, as well as a Coppice Halifax remix of Index 1.6 that reshapes the source material into a mid-fi dancefloor monster.
Recycled Plastics.credits:
released July 11, 2018
W/P by Kostas Staikos. Mastered by The Analog Botanist. Text and design by ABM&D. This is Recycled Plastics number BC69, and 69th in the Bedroom Compost series.

Recycled Plastics.title: Inner Horizon
Recycled Plastics.label: Milieu Music Digital
Recycled Plastics.about:
RP alumni Zander One returns with his third release for us, Inner Horizon. The official follow up album to 2012's amazing Echoate, Inner Horizon presents both familiar sounds and fresher approaches to the luscious Zander One template. Cozy melancholic pads overlap a womblike (and occasionally funky) rhythm section, while the humming warmth of the basslines and the distant reverb-coated lead lines carry you through Zander One's deep movements. Inner Horizon is a perfect accompaniment to the Autumn season, and a lush addition to the RP catalog. This is listening techno at its finest!
The limited edition CD-R contains two bonus remixes - Zwei Kreise's Autechre-influenced take on Vapor Trail, and Coppice Halifax's 18 minute 'Frosty Field' version of Isolation.
Recycled Plastics.credits:
released November 26, 2014
W/P by Joe Maas. Mastered by The Analog Botanist at Botany Bay, Autumn 2014. This is Recycled Plastics number BC32, and 32nd in the ongoing Bedroom Compost series.

Recycled Plastics.title: Inside The Lines
Recycled Plastics.label: Milieu Music Digital
Recycled Plastics.about: Media Them finally returns to RP, after the silent success of An Expensive Vase and Logical Love, with Inside The Lines. Continuing down the path of the undeniable and unique Media Them sound, approaching a mental centerpoint via repetition, loops used as medicine, sound applied shamanistically, audio editing as alchemy. An addressing of just what one would like to say when they sit down to create anything at all. Inside The Lines operates a bit more playfully and melodically than the previous two MT releases, although it too begins to gravitate toward pure warm emptiness and isolationism at certain points. As we wrote before about Media Them, these are not songs, so much as windows, which each provide a macrocosmic view of something basic, calming, yet curious. With Media Them, we are able to assume the viewpoint of the creator perfectly. We see what he sees, we hear as he hears. This is a process of musical and atmospheric elimination, and each window can be repeated infinitely until you feel you're able to move forward.
Recycled Plastics.credits:
released March 30, 2014
W/P by Media Them. Mastered by The Analog Botanist. This is Recycled Plastics number MT3. Digital cover designed by Eric Adrian Lee.

Recycled Plastics.title: Interstellar Foreplay
Recycled Plastics.label: Milieu Music Digital
Recycled Plastics.about:
Cybertone returns from the deepest reaches of the colorful cosmos to deliver a smashing album for our Acid Summer marathon! Interstellar Foreplay overflows with sultry chords, gyrating drums, hi-hats laced with alien club drugs and sensual melodies that enter the room with glazed over eyes. Cybertone is seriously science-fictioning up the place. Galactic blobs of neon sex funk!
Additionally, there is a limited edition CD-R version of Interstellar Foreplay that includes three protein-packed remixes by Resting Cell, Mr. Myoplast and Coppice Halifax.
Recycled Plastics.credits:
released August 7, 2013
W/P by Cybertone. Mastered by The Analog Botanist at Botany Bay, Summer 2013. This is Recycled Plastics number BC22, and the 22nd issue in the ongoing Bedroom Compost series.

Recycled Plastics.title: Jynx's Garden
Recycled Plastics.label: Milieu Music Digital
Recycled Plastics.about:
After years of planning, compiling and remastering, Recycled Plastics is beaming with pride to present JYNX'S GARDEN, a twenty-five track retrospective of music by the inimitable MRS JYNX. Containing almost completely unreleased works, going back to as early as 2004, this collection has been lovingly tidied up and sequenced by The Analog Botanist, emphasizing depth and contour for maximum aural contentment.
Musically, Mrs Jynx's work is (perhaps topically described as) the sonic equivalent of those old Lisa Frank binders girls carried to school in the 1980's - bursting with every color you can imagine, psychedelic candy for the senses. Beneath the bright sunrays and endless blue skies, however, are some truly formidable compositional and sound-design talents. Jynx's music is inherently melodic, but there's never a dull moment in her bouncing drum machine rhythms or tight, funky basslines either. You also won't find a musician beholden to using the sounds of "classic" drum machines and synthesizers - rather, Mrs Jynx makes these machines do what she wants them to do, and say what she wants them to say.
Many of these tracks have stayed with me since I first met Hannah sometime in 2006, and I've taken them everywhere - when I performed in Germany and raved about her work to people there, and whenever I found a spot for a remix on a Milieu album (or something here at RP), I'd be able to count on her to contribute only the very best work. I was ecstatic when I found out she'd been picked up by Mike Paradinas for releasing at his Planet Mu imprint, and yet - I was always amazed that these songs didn't make the cut on either of her fantastic albums there (2008's The Standoffish Cat and 2010's Shark Carousel). So, the act of assembling such a stellar compilation of my favorite Mrs Jynx music and being able to facilitate its release at my own label, is nothing short of a career highlight for me.
I'm certain that this music will bring wide smiles and tickled eardrums to people all over the world, which is exactly what the world could use more of: Happiness. Indeed, that is perhaps the best way to sum up Hannah's sublime creations - Mrs Jynx is happiness, and all you need to do is press play.
**Extra special thanks to Nicholas Knudson, who created the original painting you see on the cover especially for this album, and to Eric Adrian Lee, who assembled the whole package into the eye-popping item you see for sale before you.
Recycled Plastics.credits:
released September 1, 2017
Written and produced by Hannah Davidson. Recorded 2004-2013. All tracks written in Chorlton, Manchester, apart from 'V Is For Vienetta' which was written in Mytholmroyd, West Yorkshire & 'Silkworm' which was written in the Ardche, France. Curated, sequenced and lovingly mastered by The Analog Botanist at Botany Bay in scenic Columbia, South Carolina, 2014-2016. Original painting graciously created by Nicholas Knudson. Design and layout gently implemented by Eric Adrian Lee. This is Recycled Plastics number RP8. (c) + (p) Mrs Jynx & Recycled Plastics 2017.

trackinfo.title: Through The Double Doors Turn Right
trackinfo.label: Milieu Music Digital

Recycled Plastics.title: Kaamos
Recycled Plastics.label: Milieu Music Digital
Recycled Plastics.about: Mustatunturi returns to RP with the futurist-technoid KAAMOS (that's Finnish for "Polar Night"), a set of 10 tracks (the final three are disc-exclusives) that continue his explorations of sparse atmospheres anchored with classic techno and electro sensibilities. Lots of satisfying bleeps/bloops (or bleebs as Vainio may have called them) intertwined with a very "traditionalist" drum machine palette, bearing a bit more grittiness than the rhythms on the previous record, and many voices of synthesized bass, chords and leads that would not be out of place on a Polygon Window or Astrobotnia album. The whole of it comes together in an evocative way that both recalls pioneering works by RDJ, Atkins, Mills and of course the late  (although that last one could just be colored perception because of the Finnish connection - we do think it's a bit deeper than that...perhaps something in the air or water in Finland?) but it also feels fresh and renewed, despite using tools and sounds that are immediately somewhat familiar. Topically, Kaamos has more in common with the Lamont Kohner singles we've released, or some aspects of the Zwei Kreise and Screener36 releases, sure to delight listeners and pull them further into the future as we might yet know it.
Recycled Plastics.credits:
released October 28, 2019
W/P by Mustatunturi. Mastered by Mustatunturi. Text and design by ABM&D. This is Recycled Plastics number BC82, 82nd in the Bedroom Compost subcatalog.

Recycled Plastics.title: Knospensprung
Recycled Plastics.label: Milieu Music Digital
Recycled Plastics.about: Ndru, a German minimalist named Andre, who is also known elsewhere for his experimental works produced under the name Bored Man Ganesh, as well as helming the Organic Industries imprint, makes a stately and vibrant debut at Recycled Plastics with Knospensprung. Comprised of tracks produced in past and recent years, Knospensprung is a multifaceted set of techno assemblages that pop and fizz with playful gaiety, and this album can be seen as the first of more to be issued at our humble label. Andre has been making music for years, and his works have graced clubs and vinyl and bedrooms and headsets all over the world as his sound grows and expands. We've been in love with his music in both the rhythmic and beatless capacities for a long time and it is nothing short of a massive honor that we're able to bring you Knospensprung. For those of you who would like to purchase BC15, we've added two delectable remixes by Lamont Kohner and Coppice Halifax, both of whom have been remixed by Ndru in the past, as CDr exclusives.
Recycled Plastics.credits:
released March 30, 2013
Written and produced by Andre Gansebohm. Mastered by The Analog Botanist. This is Recycled Plastics number BC15, and 15th in the ongoing Bedroom Compost series.

Recycled Plastics.title: Le Jour Se Leve
Recycled Plastics.label: Milieu Music Digital
Recycled Plastics.about: Screener36 is a talented man named Victor, who resides in France and makes blippy squeaky trax that tickle our lobes and move our feet too. Spacious, funky, clean - Screener36's debut for RP brings to mind lots of lovely things, like Amber-era AE, CiM, Bochum Welt and even a little early Metamatics. Whatever your preference, you're sure to enjoy the catchy melodies, warm basslines and positively lush pads. A nice apertif for summer nights, supported by a very special Coppice Halifax remix and three more bonus trax on the CD-R!
Recycled Plastics.credits:
released September 11, 2016
W/P by Screener36. Mastered by The Analog Botanist. This is Recycled Plastics number BC52, and 52nd in the ongoing Bedroom Compost series.

Recycled Plastics.title: Lenticular Carpet Surfboard
Recycled Plastics.label: Milieu Music Digital
Recycled Plastics.about: For our 10th main catalog release, Recycled Plastics is happy to offer up a double-disc set of bedroom compost from the sun-baked mind of Milieu. 2+ hours of live braindance, compiled from a sweat-drenched club performance and a few studio rehearsals orbiting it. Bouncy, colorful and warm, and coaxed out of a computer-free rig of analog synthesizers, samplers, drum machines and FX. For fans of the hardware excursions on Bismuth Cosmolog, the melodic-overload of albums like Academy Stripes or the longform bliss-outs on the Eufloria soundtrack, the Lenticular Carpet Surfboard has room for just about everyone!
Recycled Plastics.credits:
released March 20, 2019
W/P by Brian Grainger. Performed live on various dates with the following hardware: Korg Minilogue / Monologue / Volca Kick / Volca Sample / Volca Keys / Volca Bass / Volca Beats, Boss DR-202 / DR-660, Arturia Microbrute, channeled through a Peavey FX2 24-channel mixer and a Mackie ProFX8 8-channel mixer, with FX including a Pioneer SR202W spring reverb box, Boss RV-3 digital reverb, BBE Two Timer analog delay, Alesis Quadraverb, Ibanez DS-5 digital delay and custom DSP patches onboard the FX2 and ProFX8. Text and design by ABM&D. Mastering by The Analog Botanist. This is Recycled Plastics number RP10.
Thanks to all the members of the Milieu Music Fan Club at Patreon! And all of the subscribers to the Deep Earth series at Bandcamp! Without you, this music might not exist!

Recycled Plastics.title: Libre Arbitre
Recycled Plastics.label: Milieu Music Digital
Recycled Plastics.about:
For the final installment of the Bedroom Compost series before we enter a new year, we bring you Arbee's seductive Libre Arbitre album. Virtually bubbling over with wild sprawls of organic electronics, Libre Arbitre delivers a warm, cuddly listening experience that is perfect for Winter. Arbee's standalone style of growing alien forms from familiar electronic pastures is once again at the forefront of these songs - at any moment, a track can twist itself from a still ambient pool of dripping notes into a clattering drunken rhythmic structure, and back again. Arbee's work is not incidentally this way, but his is a decided compositional process that leaves in all the aural hiccups and analog atmosphere.
Arbee's original concept for Libre Arbitre was for the album to include eight original tracks, and have them mirrored by eight remixes. So, the eight originals remain here for free, and the eight remixes are included on the CD-R version of Libre Arbitre. The remix personnel are: Fingers In The Noise, Bleupulp, Darren Harper, Stopmotion, Galerie Stratique, Jonas The Plugexpert, E1000 and Coppice Halifax.
You can stream all eight remixes here:  soundcloud.com/recycledplastics/sets/bc13-remixes
Recycled Plastics.credits:
released December 17, 2012
W/P by Arbee. Mastered by The Analog Botanist. This is Recycled Plastics number BC13, and thirteenth in the ongoing Bedroom Compost series.

Recycled Plastics.title: Live Cuts Vol. 1
Recycled Plastics.label: Milieu Music Digital
Recycled Plastics.about: AQ Acid Crew debuts at Recycled Plastics with the evocative Live Cuts Vol. 1. AQ is a talented young man named Erik who has a lovely way with his machines, coaxing the most organic movements and the warmest body language from acid lines and propulsive drums. Live Cuts 1, as you might imagine, is the first in a series of releases, all recorded completely live while AQ explores sonic dimensions beyond our own. At times sounding like the most authentic traditionalist acid, and at others, exercising minimal techno muscle, Live Cuts are stream of consciousness electronic music that works well in the club or the bedroom. Keep your eyes open for more installments of the AQ catalog, and be sure to pick up a copy of the limited edition CD-R, complete with bonus cuts to maximize your listening pleasure.
Recycled Plastics.credits:
released September 22, 2013
W/P by AQ Acid Crew. Mastered by The Analog Botanist at Botany Bay, September 2013. This is Recycled Plastics number AQ1.

Recycled Plastics.title: Live Cuts Vol. 2
Recycled Plastics.label: Milieu Music Digital
Recycled Plastics.about: AQ Acid Crew's second edition of Live Cuts continues his work studying the organic variance and inherent alien qualities of pure, unadulterated acid music. Venturing deep into a remote sonically heightened mindstate, AQ once again delivers some of the most engaging acid and techno we've ever had the pleasure of releasing at RP. Massive structures emerge from the hypnotic patterns AQ weaves so effortlessly - megaliths of oscillating waveforms, feedback that could be a groaning extraterrestrial tongue and browbeating drum programming that keeps you on the edge of your seat. Fans of AQ's work would be well advised to pick up the limited edition CD-R, which contains four additional mind-melting tracks, bringing the runtime close to a full 80 minutes!
Recycled Plastics.credits:
released December 20, 2013
W/P by AQ Acid Crew. Mastered by The Analog Botanist at Botany Bay, November-December 2013. This is Recycled Plastics number AQ2.

Recycled Plastics.title: Live In The Front Room
Recycled Plastics.label: Milieu Music Digital
Recycled Plastics.about:
Oxynucid is a man who has seen many summers and winters pass from the vantage point of a magical cave, nestled deep within the English woods. Having issued his libations at labels such as The Centrifuge, Complex Sound Sagacity and Body Control, his first of two slated jaunts at Recycled Plastics is this smoldering meteorite, Live In The Front Room. Featuring (you guessed it) live trax performed using a handful of analog hardware, in the heat of the moment, with barely a care placed on the production and handling of such a molten white blast of ethereal energy. Thankfully, The Analog Botanist was waiting outside the cave, alchemical herbs and reagents at the ready, willing and able to provide a comfortable home for these five primordial speaker eaters. Rough, burly and as heavy as a sleeping bear, Front Room is a workout for all of your techno muscles - yes, you, the one holding the controller. Musician! Take up thy synthesizer and walk!
As a verrah special bonus, Coppice Halifax was coaxed out of his own deep ravine in the Far Hills, to concoct an 11-minute psychedelic dub techno trip from the burnt ashes of #1-5 that Oxynucid left behind in his divine furor. CD-R only! You know what to do!
Recycled Plastics.credits:
released November 16, 2016
W/P by Oxynucid. Mastered by The Analog Botanist. This is Recycled Plastics number BC53, and 53rd in the Bedroom Compost series.

Recycled Plastics.title: Logical Love
Recycled Plastics.label: Milieu Music Digital
Recycled Plastics.about: Logical Love is the second album by Media Them at Recycled Plastics, released as part of our new MT catalog line. As the title of the opening track "Feeling Warm Inside" would indicate, this is an incredibly warm listen that surrounds you with pleasant ambience. A gentle throb of bass in the dreamy fog of swirling loops that repeat forever. Just enough hint of a melody or a rhythm to trick your brain into thinking you're listening to a developing piece of music, and not a loop, and by the time you realize the repetition, your ship has already sunk. Those of you who picked up An Expensive Vase will note the appearance of the track "Finally Forgotten" on this album as well. The answer for that is that there is no answer. Media Them creates art and we simply experience it.
Recycled Plastics.credits:
released August 28, 2013
W/P by Samuel Campbell. Mastered by The Analog Botanist at Botany Bay, Summer 2013. This is Recycled Plastics number MT2.

Recycled Plastics.title: Midnight Secrets
Recycled Plastics.label: Milieu Music Digital
Recycled Plastics.about:
For the third and final installment of his Secrets series, Axs gives RP Midnight Secrets. Perhaps alluding to the feeling one gets after being awake for far too long, Midnight Secrets is probably the weirdest and most experimental of the three volumes (and admittedly Axs' favorite as well). Where Rosewood established the roots of the Axs canon, and Evergreen painted vivid landscapes with that exposition, Midnight succeeds in pulling the Axs sound further forward, with obtuse synth gardens like 'Nightshade' (a track that could easily fit into the stark sound-art of Raster-Noton or even some of Mika Vainio's records) and the house-inflected piano and upright bass dub of 'Shift Anomaly' (which recalls producers like Terre Thaemlitz and Jeff Mills). 'Swamp Politics' features a wobbly squarewave lead and aching pad that sort of reminds us of a dubbier version of Autechre's Amber era, and 'Static Space' feels loose and shaky, as if the foundations of the rhythm itself are pulling apart as the track moves forward. Closing with the bright and spacious 'Endloop', Axs seems to say that even after three extensive archive releases, he still has a lot of sonic exploration to do. Sharing secrets has never felt so good, and we're already looking forward to the next aural excursion that awaits our ears from Axs.
Additionally, this volume (like the previous two) contains two CD-R-only bonus tracks: [Restored Picture E] and [Restored Picture CH], which is a special Coppice Halifax remix drafted specifically for the Secrets series!
Recycled Plastics.credits:
released January 17, 2014
W/P by Axs. Mastered by The Analog Botanist at Botany Bay, January 2014. This is Recycled Plastics number BC25C, and 25Cth in the Bedroom Compost series.

Recycled Plastics.title: Milkwhite Plastic Galaxy Maker
Recycled Plastics.label: Milieu Music Digital
Recycled Plastics.about:
When Coppice Halifax was first established as a peripheral project of Milieu in 2006, I never would've thought that the two different concepts would connect and overlap in the ways that they have since then. Albums like High Hawaiian Fog, Bedroom Carpet and now this one - they have all walked a very thin line between the CH sound and the Milieu sound. Milkwhite is in some ways a Halifaxian answer to a Milieu album like H Is For Hologram - all the same elements are present: classic drum machines, analog tape recording and an emphasis on a kind of "pure" bedroom electronic music. Where Hologram is more science-fiction, Milkwhite is fantasy, if that analogy makes any sense at all. I began work on this album years ago (sometime in 2010 I think) as nothing more than music for me to play at night while I passed out in bed reading a paperback. Hopefully, that aesthetic of intimate home-space music is still present in the final tracks (which themselves have been retooled and tightened up in spots, as reflected on the precursor release Sno Dreem). In short, Milkwhite is a playful set of feel-good bedroom braindance, sure to please appreciators of both the Milieu and Coppice Halifax varieties.
-Brian Grainger
Recycled Plastics.credits:
released April 28, 2012
W/P by Brian Grainger. Recorded at 114RKD, 2010. This is Recycled Plastics number RP3.

Recycled Plastics.title: Mistral
Recycled Plastics.label: Milieu Music Digital
Recycled Plastics.about:
Procedural Braindance returns with MISTRAL, a 20+ track sophomore effort that not only reiterates just how robust a generative music system can be, but ventures into colorful new ground with the format. Generally speaking, Mistral focuses a bit more on faster tempos and Tuss/Syro-esque spazzouts, replete with swollen chorus-glossed chords, roundly inflated basslines and many classic drum machine sounds in hyperactive mode. There's a little bit more of a bite to the tracks here than on Pentachroma, bringing to mind some of the cuts from Proc. Braindance's alter-ego, Face Culler. Still, for the sequencing geeks and their ilk, there're more than enough pretty melodies and pad sweeps to keep you stargazing the whole time. An absolute wonderland of synthesis and an even greater accomplishment considering the very real fact that this is 100% generative, music made and played by a program that Procedural Braindance coded and created from the ground up. We here at RP are always stunned enough at the quality on offer from this producer and his system that it becomes criminally easy to get comfortable about it. Don't sleep!
As with Pentachroma, Mistral's limited edition CD-R iteration comes with several bonus tracks exclusive to the format. Also included as digital bonuses are a video illustrating one of the PB software patches in action, and also a text document providing greater detail on the source of this generative system.
Recycled Plastics.credits:
released September 24, 2019
W/P by Procedural Braindance. Mastered by The Analog Botanist. Text and design by ABM&D. This is Recycled Plastics number BC78, and 78th in the Bedroom Compost subcatalog. (C) + (P) Procedural Braindance & Recycled Plastics 2019 / All nights preserved.

Recycled Plastics.title: Modular Allotment
Recycled Plastics.label: Milieu Music Digital
Recycled Plastics.about: A field of wheat sways in the breeze, somewhere in England. In the distance, you can just hear a stream burbling over soft rocks, mingling in and out of occasional birdsong. Sun dapples across the field and the forest onset that sits beyond it, a dark green curtain filled with mysterious incense and Earth. It's a pleasantly warm Summer day, and just as you begin to relax, your eye catches sight of an unlikely sitting chair inside the thicket. You walk toward it, curious, to find as the wheat stalks part that it is next to an old wooden record player, outfitted with bronzed detailing and a reasonably large burnt orange speaker. It doesn't appear to be plugged in, and yet, you already know it will work. At that perfect moment, you notice on the ground next to the chair a 12x12" dark green box with a cream-white bakelite handle, its color matching the deep woods behind the field perfectly. Opening the container carefully, you find five shellac discs adorned with black and gold center labels, showing floral patterns in an art nouveau style. No text, besides the initials D.O.M., seemingly engraved into the discs themselves. You tenderly place the first one onto the mystical turntable, and lower the metal arm to its etched destination. A sublime chord blooms out of the orange speaker, and seems to nudge you softly down into the chair. Like a drug, the ambience washes over you, timestretching the birdsong and flanging the sunbeams themselves. From here, you can't remember much more - just a fleeting feeling of familiarity, like a place you visited as a child and barely remember. Suddenly aware of yourself again, you finish reading the description of Oxynucid's newest album on Bandcamp, and think to yourself: "Did I already press play? Have I been here before?" Intrigued, you dare to press the play button (again?), just to find out...
Recycled Plastics.credits:
released October 2, 2017
W/P by Oxynucid. Mastered by The Analog Botanist. This is Recycled Plastics number BC59, and 59th in the Bedroom Compost series.

Recycled Plastics.title: Monophon
Recycled Plastics.label: Milieu Music Digital
Recycled Plastics.about:
Joining RP's expanding roster is Andre Zufall, better known to many of you as Mon0. Having released several excellent albums on Kreislauf, Test Tube, Silent Season and Sublime Porte, he has spent quite some time refining his own special brand of deep ambient drones and rhythmic pulsing techno. Monophon is possibly Recycled Plastics' deepest release yet, in terms of complete disconnected minimalist techno - longform tracks filled with dark passages of drones and rumbling low end, which eventually give way to womblike rhythms and organic percussive elements that build up like a storm cloud. Mon0 is a master of hypnotizing you with frequency alone, before gradually lifting up the curtain and revealing the alien machinery he's built to receive and capture the raw slow breath of the cosmos.
Included on the limited edition CD-R version is an additional 9 minute track (Instability) plus three mutant remix works by Zzzzra, Zwei Kreise and Coppice Halifax. A full eighty minute sonic odyssey awaits you!
Recycled Plastics.credits:
released November 10, 2014
Written and produced by Andre Zufall. Mastered by The Analog Botanist at Botany Bay, Summer 2014. This is Recycled Plastics number BC36, and 36th in the ongoing Bedroom Compost series.

Recycled Plastics.title: Motorbalm
Recycled Plastics.label: Milieu Music Digital
Recycled Plastics.about: The underground UK dancefloor debonair Simon Meredith makes his debut with the Motorbalm EP. Six movers'n'shakers for your decks and (disco)balls. Inspired by the revolutionary minimal sound of German techno like Kompakt and combining that with his own roots in British dance music, Mr. Meredith has assembled an immediate and undeniably groovy sound that is both familiar and fresh. Also available on a limited edition CD-R with an exclusive bonus track!
Recycled Plastics.credits:
released March 26, 2012
W/P by Simon Meredith. Recorded at 28 Pause, London, 2001. This is Recycled Plastics number BC5, and is fifth in the Bedroom Compost series.

Recycled Plastics.title: Nightly
Recycled Plastics.label: Milieu Music Digital
Recycled Plastics.about: Lamont Kohner once again graces our catalog with NIGHTLY, another two-track single of oil-slicked techno chug and abandoned factory-floor bass. Backed with CHROMATOSE, these two cuts once again assert that Kohner has the hands of an old master, dominating a dancefloor while remaining just elusive enough to continually reveal hidden peaks and valleys inside the wash of low end and nightlife neon. NIGHTLY recalls a bit of Rhythm & Sound / Main Street classic dub thump before getting impatient and riding some cymbal over a slo-mo house kick and clap. CHROMATOSE spaces out the space even more, with a distant woodblock that could just as easily be heard through a wet drain coming up from a standpipe, and chords doubling the claps that remind us a little of classic Kompakt schaffel and Speicher barnburners. Just a drop on the tongue, you wouldn't dare take any more of this into your system!
Recycled Plastics.credits:
released February 17, 2020
W/P by Lamont Kohner. Text and design by ABM&D. This is Recycled Plastics number K4, and fourth in the K subcatalog of Lamont Kohner recordings.

Recycled Plastics.title: Nitelight
Recycled Plastics.label: Milieu Music Digital
Recycled Plastics.about: Following his retro-futuristic dub techno album Terrain Scan, Specta Ciera (known elsewhere as Devroka and half of Drexon Field) returns to Recycled Plastics with a new twelve-tracker, Nitelight, packed full of rubbery synth basslines, funky electro rhythms and rainbow-chroma hooks, virtually tumbling out of the speakers like a giftbox full of melodies. This new album invokes/evokes a whole lot of interesting cornerstones from the last fifty years of electronic music - shades of Kraftwerk, Juan Atkins and Drexciya rub shoulders with chiptune bubbles that come spraying out of a champagne bottle at a Jan Hammer boat party in Miami...wriggling monosynth lines squirm and splash in the bright blue seawater, which washes up on the shores of Clear-era Metamatics 12"s and Shibuya-kei neon coastlines dotted with Cornelius clubs and YMO arcades. Truly, these tracks recall other RP catalog moments like Sint's Zonmist, 101's (Para)Normal Life and both Cybertron releases, as well as the starry-eyed pop compositions of Mrs Jynx, NN* and Foamek, arriving right on time for the cool and invigorating nights that creep in with the Autumn, just when you thought Summer burnout had you bummed.
Recycled Plastics.credits:
released November 6, 2020
W/P by Devin Underwood. Mastered by The Analog Botanist. This is Recycled Plastics number BC89, 89th in the Bedroom Compost catalog. Text and design by ABM&D.  recycled-plastics.net analogbotany.com  (C) + (P) 2020 Specta Ciera & Recycled Plastics / All nights preserved

Recycled Plastics.title: No Sense
Recycled Plastics.label: Milieu Music Digital
Recycled Plastics.about:
Substak returns from Greece with his second album for Recycled Plastics - NO SENSE. Following 2015's beautifully isolated BEATLESS album, No Sense offers up another side of the Substak sound. Where Beatless employed gratuitous sub-bass and sculpted pulses out of the lower end of the frequency spectrum, No Sense feels a bit lighter, airier and more cleanly produced. Substak's trademark elements of rhythmic presence, with or without drums, as well as his fascination with deep blue atmospheric loops are still present, slightly augmented by distant percussive sounds or gritty textural sections that rise out of filter passes like giant waves. No Sense reveals Substak's ability to compose with reverb and filtering as his primary instruments, shaping the sound in subtle ways and giving the listener a feeling of experiencing these aural events from different perspectives. Things feel almost like planetary bodies moving closer and further apart all at once, with the recordings documenting momentary alignments and harmonies. All of this may sound tense and slightly foreboding on paper, but Substak has a way of taking alien sonics and conveying them through native tongues - mutation into transmutation. No Sense is a total head trip that feels far longer than its 45 minute runtime, proving that depth and gravity can be achieved in other ways beyond length, with Substak serving as a master of dimension.
If you enjoy No Sense, definitely pick up a copy of the limited edition CD-R, which contains a gorgeous 13 minute bonus track to close the record.
Recycled Plastics.credits:
released January 26, 2018
W/P by Kostas Staikos. Mastered by The Analog Botanist. This is Recycled Plastics number BC65, and 65th in the ongoing Bedroom Compost series. Design by ABM&D.

Recycled Plastics.title: Notte Variations
Recycled Plastics.label: Milieu Music Digital
Recycled Plastics.about:
Drive Dub is a new moniker for Dimitar Dodovski, elsewhere known for his varied works at labels such as Databloem and Shimmering Moods, or for his Moss Garden collaboration with Lee Norris of Metamatics and Norken. Despite all of these prior iterations, Drive Dub feels entirely fresh and vibrant, an atmosphere of its own.
Topically, it reminds us of playful analog meanderings from Pub, Chain Reaction, Russ Gabriel and of course the ubiquitous early Warp and Rephlex catalogs. Beyond those mentions, however, it dives a bit deeper and connects to more Detroit and Berlin grades of techno and ambient music, which would appeal to fans of the dub techno and braindance sides of the RP catalog.
A perfect playmate with the new Brother Blue EP, Notte Variations offers five excursions for intimate nighttime drives, bedroom rest (or recreation) and of course the dancefloor. Listeners who support the limited edition CD-R version of Notte Variations will be rewarded with a disc-exclusive Coppice Halifax remix of Notte 3!
Recycled Plastics.credits:
released January 29, 2019
W/P by Dimitar Dodovski. Mastered by The Analog Botanist. This is Recycled Plastics number BC74, and 74th in the Bedroom Compost series.

Recycled Plastics.title: Occlipse
Recycled Plastics.label: Milieu Music Digital
Recycled Plastics.about:
Following the spastic ER-1 showcase that was the VLISS EP, Bike has once again returned to RP with two lengthy tracks of live hardware improvisation: OCCLIPSE. Produced using a Boss DR-660 drum machine in tandem with four Korg Volca machines, a Roland SH-32 polysynth and the enigmatic Grass C-TCM medical unit, OCCLIPSE is full to the brim with ring modulated rust and sub-bass gristle. Still, perhaps uncharacteristically for Bike, it also contains strains of melodic melancholy, however distant and bent they may be, that recall Brian's influences from Loess, Musik Aus Strom and Arovane's early DIN 12"s, among the usual hallmarks from things like late nineties Autechre and Gescom material.
OCCLIPSE is also the first release in the Bedroom Compost catalog to be made available for sale digitally, instead of name-your-price. With rising costs of operation, shipping hikes and all manner of other expenses associated with maintaining an ever-growing pulsating brain of electronic music, we at RP feel it is a small change that should be rather inconsequential to most of our listeners, and will allow the label a bit more assurances in staying open, through dry seasons and financial hardship alike. From this moment forward, all digital releases in the Bedroom Compost series have gone from $0.00 to $1.11. We thank you for your support, kindness and understanding.
For supporters of the physical format: OCCLIPSE may or may not include unlisted remixes as bonus tracks, produced by unnamed parties.
Recycled Plastics.credits:
released November 11, 2018
W/P by Bike. Recorded live at White Pillar Workshop on February 24, 2018. Mastered by The Analog Botanist. This is Recycled Plastics number BC73, and 73rd in the Bedroom Compost catalog. Text and design by ABM&D.

Recycled Plastics.title: Ohms
Recycled Plastics.label: Milieu Music Digital
Recycled Plastics.about: For the second entry in the Bedroom Compost series, The Jaffa Kid turns in some of the freshest bedroom braindance you'll hear in 2011! Leading off his album with a sharp new version of a track previously released on the superb Wrangled Mangled album (see: Expanding Electronic Diversity circa 2007) and maintaining a high level of quality melodic electronic music with a heavy dose of analog warmth. Though not too many people know The Jaffa Kid, he's produced enough quality braindance to be considered braindance royalty, according to us. Recommended if you like oldschool playful RDJ, Ovuca or the Vibert/Simmonds records. Grab it!
Recycled Plastics.credits:
released December 18, 2011
W/P The Jaffa Kid. Gently mastered/sequenced by The Analog Botanist. This is Recycled Plastics number BC2, and second in the Bedroom Compost series.

Recycled Plastics.title: Ohms 2.1
Recycled Plastics.label: Milieu Music Digital
Recycled Plastics.about: The Jaffa Kid returns with a two-part 19-track set: Ohms 2.1 and Ohms 2.2! Filled to the brim with inventive beatwork, catchy melodies from dusty synths and enough droning electronic weirdness to keep the menu fresh. Bedroom music, to the MAX! Divided neatly into two pre-measured braindance dosages, for your listening convenience.
Recycled Plastics.credits:
released March 27, 2012
W/P by The Jaffa Kid. Mastered and sequenced by The Analog Botanist. This is Recycled Plastics number BC6. Sixth in the ongoing Bedroom Compost series.

Recycled Plastics.title: Ohms 2.2
Recycled Plastics.label: Milieu Music Digital
Recycled Plastics.about: The Jaffa Kid returns with a two-part 19-track set: Ohms 2.1 and Ohms 2.2! Filled to the brim with inventive beatwork, catchy melodies from dusty synths and enough droning electronic weirdness to keep the menu fresh. Bedroom music, to the MAX! Divided neatly into two pre-measured braindance dosages, for your listening convenience.
Recycled Plastics.credits:
released March 27, 2012
W/P by The Jaffa Kid. Mastered and sequenced by The Analog Botanist. This is Recycled Plastics number BC7. Seventh in the ongoing Bedroom Compost series.

Recycled Plastics.title: On Doing/Being Ordinary
Recycled Plastics.label: Milieu Music Digital
Recycled Plastics.about:
Right on time for the turning of the leaves and the smoky Autumn air wafting through purple skies, is Foamek. He's been working on this full-length album for years, and boy does it show. With feet planted in braindance, trance and clubby techno camps, there's a unique sound palette on display here that never feels forced or unnatural - rather, we're able to enjoy sounds as they breathe and bump into each other across solid rhythmic currents, and one can easily observe Foamek being in complete command of his abilities, plucking melodies from the tape-hiss soaked/smoked air and filling up his drums with thick bass like they're gallon jugs.
On Doing/Being Ordinary seems to be a very personal statement from Foamek, one we're admittedly not too used to receiving and releasing at RP, where artistic escapism is the lay of the land. There are moments of bittersweetness, as on the title track and (the gorgeous curtain call) Avalon, as well as deeper passages of highway-driving introspection, like In Transit or Fever Dream. Further still are moments of blissful, beaming happiness, like Little Maine Coon and Age, connecting to elements of Foamek in full-on party mode (just TRY listening to Backyard Rave without moving your feet). When I first found Foamek's music in 2007, and we embarked upon four different split releases together, his work was just as playful and melodically accessible. Since then, however, it feels as if it has truly aged along with him, and Doing/Being stands as an expressive document of a person who has taken all of these things with them. These ideas feel very lived-in and comfortable, even when they are sad, and perhaps that's what Foamek is positing in his title statement: A little bit of comfort can go a long, long way.
For the heads: Grab one of the limited edition CD-Rs, as they contain three bonus tracks not present on the digital release!
Recycled Plastics.credits:
released November 13, 2017
W/P by Jake Davis. Mastered by The Analog Botanist. This is Recycled Plastics number BC62, and 62nd in the Bedroom Compost catalog.

Recycled Plastics.title: (Para)Normal Life
Recycled Plastics.label: Milieu Music Digital
Recycled Plastics.about:
101, perhaps more well known by his dub techno alias Giriu Dvasios, has been a quiet but potent source of solidly crafted braindance in the last few years. Having released three previous 101 albums (they're all fantastic) at his own Cold Tear imprint across the sea, RP gave him the secret handshake that allowed us to import this fantastic hardware funk jam to you dear people. What follows is a tightly produced record filled with many of the classic staples of the bedroom techno scene - vintage drum machines, acid lines with added squelch, firm basslines ready for your bins. Nothing unexpected, but that's exactly what's to be expected here at RP. Of course, the most defining element of 101's work is his ear for melody, and you'll find plenty here!
The limited edition CD-R version comes with two bonus tracks!
Recycled Plastics.credits:
released August 31, 2015
W/P by Evaldas Azbukauskas. Mastered by The Analog Botanist. This is Recycled Plastics number BC44, and 44th in the Bedroom Compost catalog.

trackinfo.title: Do You Like My Material Belongings?
trackinfo.label: Milieu Music Digital

Recycled Plastics.title: Pentachroma
Recycled Plastics.label: Milieu Music Digital
Recycled Plastics.about:
Procedural Braindance is a new project from the mind of a man named Troy, more widely known as Face Culler, which is (to our knowledge) the first of its kind. He has written thousands of lines of programming code to facilitate a software system that intelligently and intuitively generates braindance music in a matter of seconds, and performs it on a studio rig of analog synthesizers, drum machines and modular units.
Unlike the generative music of the past, this is music that has been designed to be indistinguishable from something made by a human. In this, we believe Troy has created something groundbreaking and game-changing, and we have a massive amount of pride and excitement to bring you the debut of this project at Recycled Plastics! This is a truly before and after moment in modern electronic music, and one that we feel will ripple outward for a long, long time, both in Troy's hands and beyond.
For this special occasion, Troy has indulged our curiosity and helped us put together this informative video, which explains and contextualizes what Procedural Braindance is all about:  youtu.be/U6RNDRj6J2M
Musically, Pentachroma is an album that refuses to be outshined by the process that created it. If it were never made apparent that these pieces were created by a machine, we would be none the wiser about it. The album is virtually bursting with melodic color and variance - burbling acid lines bouncing over tight, funky drum patterns, and a nearly-constant barrage of fat, warm bass work fills up a nearly-80 minute set of tracks that are built to last. The melodies, as gorgeous as they often are, draw an emotive line throughout the album that perhaps gives the biggest reason to think this was a human's doing.
Procedural Braindance is absolutely the sound of the future, today. We have arrived!
(Parties interested in contacting Procedural Braindance may reach him at the following locations:  www.facebook.com/proceduralbraindance/  and  www.soundcloud.com/proceduralbraindance/  )
**Editor's note: Collectors and completionists would be advised to pick up the limited edition CD-R, which features no less than five additional tracks!

Recycled Plastics.title: Picture Of A City
Recycled Plastics.label: Milieu Music Digital
Recycled Plastics.about:
FX JACKSON brings us PICTURE OF A CITY, an album of lush late-nineties flavored bedroom electronics that shifts effortlessly between acidic techno, bleepy synthpop and rubberized electro. Recalling all kinds of classic recordings from Speedy J, Beaumont Hannant and Fuse, as well as shades of Polygon Window and the deeper waters of early Autechre and B12, PICTURE OF A CITY does what so many Recycled Plastics releases do so well: Invoke the past without attempting to compete with it or replicate it. This is headphone or car-stereo appropriate music for wandering and thinking, as well as the more predictable inclusion in a club or DJ set. Flexible, emotive and well-produced, a perfect fit for our ongoing catalog.
FOR THE HEADS: The limited edition CD-R of BC84 includes an exclusive track called "Tongo" and a bouncy Milieu remix of "Tongo" alongside it!

Recycled Plastics.title: Pink Acre
Recycled Plastics.label: Milieu Music Digital
Recycled Plastics.about: At long last, after a year and a half of work, the follow-up to Milkwhite Plastic Galaxy Maker has arrived! Pink Acre is the first of two scheduled cassettes containing the most melodic and playful Coppice Halifax trax in years. Nestled in bedroom warmth and backyard field recordings, filled with echoing moments of adventuring with my daughter, Pink Acre bounds through green grass and crashes into honeysuckles, before curling up on a worn out sofa for a nap in a sunbeam. The music on this release and the Acre that will soon follow is for my daughter Penelope, to assist in her frequent jaunts of toybox carpet fantasies and her humming snoozes in the backseat of my car. Miniature soundtracks for roaming, dreaming, bouncing and brainstorming.
Recycled Plastics.credits:
released February 3, 2017
W/P by Brian Grainger. Recorded at Botany Bay & White Pillar Workshop, 2015-2017. Mastered by The Analog Botanist. This is Recycled Plastics number RPC2-A.

Recycled Plastics.title: Pink Plastic
Recycled Plastics.label: Milieu Music Digital
Recycled Plastics.about:
"Nestled in bedroom warmth and backyard field recordings, filled with echoing moments of adventuring with my daughter, Pink Plastic bounds through green grass and crashes into honeysuckles, before curling up on a worn out sofa for a nap in a sunbeam. Miniature soundtracks for roaming, dreaming, bouncing and brainstorming."
PINK PLASTIC collects two out of print cassette tapes from Spring 2017 (PINK ACRE / PLASTIC ACRE) and reinstates them for the first time on the compact-disc-recordable format, alongside three other tracks from the sessions (Placid Yellow / Litebrite / Pink Plastic) and one previously unreleased track (Amber Pier). Eighteen bouncy wonderlands for playtime, scenic drives and even a few quiet pastoral sections suitable for a midday nap. PINK PLASTIC is the follow-up to MILKWHITE PLASTIC GALAXY MAKER and continues the familiar (but not overly so) path of Rephlexian braindance and early Warpish ambient techno, seen and heard through the lens of Coppice Halifax, a project typically associated with more textural and dubby endeavors. Altogether, it is a two-hour offering of easy and accessible bedroom electronics guaranteed to bring a smile at the end of a terrible and exhausting year that we're all eager to forget about.

Recycled Plastics.title: Plays Distrans Telekomm
Recycled Plastics.label: Milieu Music Digital
Recycled Plastics.about:
Originally broadcast live during the release party for Milieu's "Sunbather's Pharmacopeia (Volume 2)" at Touched, UK, this mentalist DJ set provides a solid introduction to Telekomm - a new project from Brian Grainger (Milieu, Coppice Halifax, Bike, et al) that has been in development for over eight years. This set is built out of mostly Telekomm trax, with a few adjacent Milieu/Vhom/Troth jams slotted in, but only the eagle-eyed trainspotters would really be able to pick them apart in a lineup. We've indexed the tracks here for easier navigation, but the download for this release also includes the unabridged set as a single file.
MAXIMUM VOLUME YIELDS MAXIMUM RESULTS
For more Telekomm (and there will be much more in the future) please dial "T" at  telekomm.bandcamp.com  - There may already be something else to discover there...
Additionally, to explore the debut Telekomm recording, please visit Humanhood Recordings and investigate "Input Void," a beatless experiment built with the North American dial tone as its sole sound source, available digitally and on a limited edition CD-R:  humanhoodrecordings.bandcamp.com/album/input-void

Recycled Plastics.title: PolyPlus
Recycled Plastics.label: Milieu Music Digital
Recycled Plastics.about:
A super-special remix album for Milieu's Polypsilon - PolyPlus! Jam packed with eighteen tracks, filled with all the essential braindance minerals and vitamins to get you through your day.
PolyPlus contains two new Milieu cuts from the Polypsilon sessions: the funky 'PolyPlus' and the mellow 'Polysurpher'. Enlisting the help of producers from both Recycled Plastics' back catalog as well as friends from labels like Occult Research and Cold Tear, PolyPlus is a dynamic fusion of melodic braindance, acid techno and even Artificial Intelligence-era bedroom electronics. A lower PH level than your pool! (Thanks to P.S.A. for the PSA).
This album is available on three formats - digital, limited edition CD-R and a super-short-run 90M cassette edition. The latter contains two exclusive tracks - Milieu's disto-funk tape jam 'Sofaphonk 89' and Zander One's overdriven Acid Mix of Polypsilon!
Recycled Plastics.credits:
released May 17, 2015
Written by Brian Grainger. Produced and remixed by the credited artists. Used with permission. Mastered by The Analog Botanist. This is Recycled Plastics number RP6.

Recycled Plastics.title: Polypsilon, Part 1
Recycled Plastics.label: Milieu Music Digital
Recycled Plastics.about:
Polypsilon, Part 1 is - as the title implies - the first half of two separate 60-minute cassette releases, and the first tape released at RP!
As a Milieu album, Polypsilon is possibly the most "genre music" type thing Milieu has done, filled with all the staples of feel-good braindance as well as my first foray into acid. The recording sessions were impulsive and tangential, and by the end, there was far more material than I was expecting to make, giving way to this two-part release.
It's probably a spiritual follow-up to Academy Stripes, although it should be noted that Polypsilon was intended to be a sidetrack thing, and not "the next big new Milieu record", so I guess consider it as a gigantic 2 hour EP.
I can't really think about how to describe it, so I'll leave you with the music. There's lots of 606/707/808 drum machine action, as well as my usual soft spot for a couple breaks and my Korg ER-1, and the synths used include my Roland SH-32, Casio PSS-50 and MT-210, the wonderful Fahtacon softsynth made by my friend Robin and of course the Milieu go-to Lowrey Magic Genie organ, among other things. Everything was meant to be loose, sporadic, playful and tingly on the earlobes, so hopefully that comes through in the final result.
Remember, this isn't braindance - it's BRIANDANCE!
Recycled Plastics.credits:
released January 30, 2014
W/P by Brian Grainger. Recorded at Botany Bay, November 2013-January 2014. Mastered by The Analog Botanist. This is Recycled Plastics number RPC1-A.

Recycled Plastics.title: Polypsilon, Part 2
Recycled Plastics.label: Milieu Music Digital
Recycled Plastics.about: Hot on the heels of Part 1 comes Polypsilon, Part 2! The second half of the BRIAN-DANCE odyssey is another hour of colorful electronics and bedroom production values. Arguably more diverse than Part 1, with krautrock influenced motorik tracks like "Paul The Pylon", jungle strains in "Phallusaurus Jox", a little Boards of Canada peeking through in "Polly Epsilon" and a nod to SAW 85-92 on "P-Boots". Of course, melodies are still the focus of the material, along with a nice settled in comfort level from working with so many familiar sounds and machines. The whole thing inevitably caves in by the end, and trails off along some long-lost ambient coastline from the depths of my mind. Printed and pressed on a super-limited special edition of 30 copies on white cassette tape, with hand-cut red cardstock J-cards and black text decals. Don't miss out!
Recycled Plastics.credits:
released March 13, 2014
W/P by Brian Grainger. Recorded at Botany Bay, 2013-2014. Mastered by The Analog Botanist. This is Recycled Plastics number RPC1-B.

Recycled Plastics.title: Polypsilon [Polytone Dual-Disk Edition]
Recycled Plastics.label: Milieu Music Digital
Recycled Plastics.about:
At long last, the definitive edition of Milieu's bedroom wonderland Polypsilon! Collecting all 29 tracks from the Part 1 and Part 2 cassettes, and including four bonus tracks (Sofaphonk 89, from the cassette edition of PolyPlus, Acid Volunteers from the Acid Tryouts compilation, Golden Flake Theme from a super-rare web compilation and a previously unreleased ambient mix of Polly Epsilon), filling out two action-packed CD-Rs dripping with pretty melodies, expressive acid lines and drum work that runs the gamut from house and techno to electro and jungle. Inspired by classic music like AFX, Kerrier District, Ovuca and Bochum Welt, as well as modern favorites like Automatic Tasty, EOD, NN* and Mrs Jynx, Polypsilon is the first truly ACID Milieu effort, where only hints of the sound appeared before on albums like H Is For Hologram, Academy Stripes and Milkwhite Plastic Galaxy Maker - guaranteed to tickle your eardrums and leave you satisfied, or exhausted, whichever comes first.
"Strung-out sci-fi synths to skittering drum machines with trance-inducing results" -Columbia's Free Times
"This release is astounding" -Cybertone
"Sounding rather sexy!" -Some guy on a forum
"Spent the last of my wage on this, because Milieu never disappoints." -Another guy on a forum
"It definitely qualifies as acid." -Yet another forum post (Hi WATMM!)
Recycled Plastics.credits:
released March 3, 2016
W/P by Brian Grainger. Recorded at Botany Bay, November 2013-January 2014. Mastered by The Analog Botanist. This is Recycled Plastics number RPC1.
